texts.en: Doña Carmen, as she is known to friends, is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children, a boy of 12 who is in secondary school and a daughter of 4 who recently entered preschool. Doña Carmen has been a seamstress for 25 years. She says that from a very early age she was drawn to the sewing machine. She says "I love sewing because you can make your own clothes as well as your children's school uniforms."She also sells home cleaning products of a very well-known brand. She sells stove-cleaning products, deodorizers, cleaning products and body creams. She says that she has been selling these products for over 18 years and that she likes the business as she has been able to get to know a lot of the people who buy her products. Doña Carmen is asking for a loan to buy cleaning products she has on order for her customers. She is happy because thanks to the loan she will be able to give clients what they ordered. Doña Carmen says that she goes out on a daily basis to sell her products by catalogue and collect payment as she gets paid in installments for her products  Carmen's current goal is to buy a newer sewing machine so that she can keep on sewing.

loans.use: to buy home cleaning products by catalogue

loans.name: Cho-Estancia Group

texts.es:
La señora Florinda es casada, tiene 30 años D. edad, cursó los 4 años D. educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 D. los cuales estudia, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, inició con esta labor ya que quiere obtener un buenísimo beneficio para su familia, lleva 8 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción D. vivienda.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra D. pollos para engorD. para venderlos cuando crezcan y obtener su ganancia. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio y a actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Florinda is 30 years old, married, and completed four years of elementary school. She has two children, but only one has started school. Florinda raises livestock for a living, which she started doing in order to help her family. She has 8 years of experience and the full support of her husband, who works in construction. 

Florinda decided to put together a group for this loan request. She'll use her portion to buy chickens. She plans to raise them and sell the full-grown chickens for a profit. The other members of the group work in business and agriculture.

loans.use: buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Exodus Romac Group

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old and lives in Gweru. She has six children, one of whom is still at school. Grace's husband buys and sells a variety of items and Grace rears and sells chickens, a business she has been running for four years. She faces problems with the cold killing small chicks and has suffered theft.
Grace will invest the money that she borrows by extending the chicken coop and buying more chicks. She hopes that her business will continue to provide her family with a good life and an improved diet.

loans.use: to buy chicks and building materials to extend chicken run.

loans.name: Daniel Njogu

texts.en: Daniel is a 63-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 17 years to 30 years. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a shoe making business where he sells shoes to locals. He has been involved in this business for 40 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a shopping centre in Kisumu. He describes his biggest business challenge as financial constraints. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to use in the running of the business. His business goal is to open more shoe shops within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will own the biggest shoe selling business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Agossa

texts.fr:
Agossa est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est célibataire.  
Agossa travaille comme revendeur depuis 2008. Il achète et revend des huiles à moteur à tous les usagers d’engins à moteur, dans sa boutique à Lomé. Il travaille avec une personne. 
Agossa a requis son premier crédit de 300.000FCFA de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons d’huile à moteur destinées à la vente. Il veut avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité, agrandir sa boutique. 
Dans les prochaines années, Agossa voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de ventes. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit  avoir une meilleure situation financière.
texts.en:
Agossa is a 32-year-old single man who has been working as a retailer since 2008.  He buys engine oil which he re-sells to anybody who uses engine oil, in his store in Lomé.  He works with the help of one other person.

Agossa has requested his first loan from WAGES, for 300,000 frances, to buy boxes of engine oil to sell.  He would like to use the extra income from his business to increase the size of his store.

In the coming years, Agossa would like to open other sales locations.  He says that he plans to use his profits to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy engine oil

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La socia tiene una panadería y actualmente a incorporado los pasteles para la venta, ella prepara kekes de vainilla y chocolate llamados kekes marmoleados, la socia también prepara pastelitos y pie de manzana, entre otros pastelitos, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de harinas, levaduras, escencias entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de harinas, levaduras y otros.
texts.en: This member owns a bakery and has just incorporated pastries into her sales.  She prepares marbled cupcakes, which contain vanilla and chocolate batter.  She also prepares miniature pastries, apple pies, and other desserts.  The member wants to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, essences, and other ingredients.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to use for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, essences, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 29 years old and married. He lives in the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. Though they don't have siblings, still he works hard to sustain their daily needs and improve the business of his wife. Farming is primarily the main source of family income.

Jomar has been farming his cornfield for over eight years and he has been managing about four hectares. With his determination to improve his cornfield, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 27,000. This amount would really help his farming business to be more productive because he will be using his requested loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and certified seed. He hopes that he could make his dream come true, which is to maintain his cornfield and make it more productive. In this way, his profit will increase, which will help him improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Rorn is employed at a factory, and her husband sells palm products. Rorn is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase groceries to sell in front of her house. By doing so, her family will able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина – вдова, у нее взрослые сыновья. Она занимается выращиванием ранних сельхозкультур в теплицах, а именно высаживает цветную капусту и помидоры для последующей реализации овощной продукции. Галина живет и занимается фермерством в селе Приветное, Цурюпинского района. Она занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. В хозяйство вложено 40 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 3 800 гривен.  

Галина планирует использовать кредит в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, удобрения, пленку и отремонтировать теплицы. Ей нравится заниматься сельским хозяйством и выращивать ранние овощи, потому что это перспективный бизнес и к тому же он дает стабильную возможность содержать семью.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Galina is a widow and has adult sons.  She is involved in growing early agricultural crops in greenhouses and specifically, grows cauliflower and tomatoes until the next sales of vegetable produce.  Galina lives and works in the Privetnoye village in the Tsyurupynsk district.  She has been involved in this business for ten years.  Galina invested 40 000 hryvnia into her farm.  Her net profit is 3 800 hryvnia.  Galina plans to use the 7 000 hryvnia loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, plastic and to repair a greenhouse.  She likes to be involved in agriculture and grow early vegetables because this is a promising business, which provides for a stable opportunity to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, plastic and to repair a greenhouse

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.en:
Atanacio is 45 years of age and blessed with four children. He is satisfied in his work as a farmer. He stated that although he couldn't finish his education, he has a fruitful occupation that serves as a source of income for his family's every need. 

He is sending all his children to school and hopes they attain their goals. It is not easy to provide for their educational needs because of the high cost of tuition. However, he works hard and requests a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy inputs to develop his farm. For better results, he needs to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. He also needs to pay for the labor of a co-farmer.

Hopefully, through his sacrifices and hard work, he can attain a better outcome, improve his family's poor living standards, and experience a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay for labor by a co-farmer

loans.name: 03.2.86 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinh operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Sinh is 26 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 86 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. Sinh lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Sinh has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Sinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos de primera necesidad, ella inicia su día con los quehaceres del hogar,  tiene también una pequeña granja de cerdos la cual atiende, su horario no es específico, pues esta todo el día en el hogar atendiendo a quienes llegan a comprar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como aceite, arroz, gaseosas, galletas, dulces entre otros productos, de esta manera podrá incrementar y atender mejor a los clientes con productos de calidad.
Su aspiración es de esta compra, surtir y generar mayores ventas, trabajar fuertemente para sacar adelante a su familia en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her three children and husband. She earns her living selling basic supplies. She begins each day with household chores including caring for a small number of pigs. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule but stays around the house all day ready to serve anyone who comes into the store. 

Teresa is seeking a loan to buy merchandise for the store such as oil, rice, soft drinks, cookies, and candy so she can provide her customers with quality items. She hopes that the increased stock in her store will result in greater sales. Teresa works hard to help her family, her children especially, get on in life.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, soft drinks, cookies, candy etc.

loans.name: Ruwa Kumari

texts.en:
Ruwa Kumari is 32 year-old. She is married and has 3 children, aged 15, 14 and 10.  In 2000 she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizer for her business. In the future, Ruwa Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Esther, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 46-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family, with a husband and three children, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Chuka, in the central region of Kenya. For the past ten years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. 
Esther passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and to buy a chaff cutter. The dairy unit will assist Esther in managing her cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions. Esther also intends to buy a chaff cutter which is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces so that cows wont refuse any part of the food. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and through this loan she will be making more money. Esther will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Esther will achieve this. An increase in income will allow Esther to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Esther fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide their reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

You can help Esther to be closer to her goals, and a loan will do that.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaffcutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Irene would like to buy sacks of maize and bean , flour, sugar and laundry detergents

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy operates a business which offers beverages, and women and children’s clothing. She began her business in 1986. The business prospered until 1991 when she went through a hard time during the 90s due to the political and economic instability in the DRCongo. Lucy learned about Hope’s microfinance program through a friend and decided to sign a loan contract. Today, Lucy is on her way to stabilizing her business. She requests a loan of $500, which she will use to buy her merchandise in bulk order to minimize purchase prices.  She also plans to diversify her business by adding men’s clothing so that she can increase her earnings and meet the high demand from the community. Right now,Lucy has $300 in business capital. She is married and has six children.

loans.use: To expand her business by diversifying the brands and types of items she sells

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mr. Moa B. R., 42 years old, is a father of 7 children, and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a secondary school teacher and also runs a business near the school as a vehicle care-taker. R. normally makes around $5 per day, while his wife makes a very small amount of money from working at the local garment factory. Additonally, two of his children work at the same factory as their mother does. 3 of the other children are students and 2 are too young to attend school. B. R. is asking for an $800 loan to build a temporary station where he can keep and guard the students' vehicles.  In the future, he would like to have enough money to run a grocery store in front of the school.

loans.use: To construct a temporary station to run his business

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
K. Nigora was a seller of boiled peas, one of the Tajiks' favourite dishes. But as the competition for this kind of business was very high, it became less profitable. With the financial help of her husband, Nigora started a business selling household goods. Her mother also supported her and gave her a shop. Nigora’s sister-in-law helps with selling products.

Six months ago, Nigora received a loan from Microinvest that helped her to expand her assortment of products. At the moment, one can find anything that is needed for the home in her shop.

If Nigora can get a second loan, it will help her to develop her business further and make more profit. This is very important as Nigora has three kids and her business brings in significant income for the family.

loans.use: to further develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothing for her business

loans.name: Marita Astra

texts.es:
Marita is a mother of three, two of her sons are studying Systems Engineering at university. The youngest son is still in primary school and lives in her home along with her husband. She started selling bread as there were no bakeries near her neighborhood. Her artisan oven and keen business acumen have helped her to produce delicious bread, which her sons and husband help to dispatch from their bakery located next to their home.

The family business produces enough bread daily to meet the current demand, but they would like to increase their production. They need more raw materials to increase bread production to be able to grow the business. Let´s help Marita accomplish her dreams of having a well furnished bakery and home delivery of her excellent bread.

Marita wants to generate jobs in the community and help her family grow financially by fulfilling a basic need for her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Marita es madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian en la universidad la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas y el último aún está en el colegio y habita con su querido esposo su modesto hogar. Ella empezó con el negocio de la venta de panes debido a que por la zona donde vive no hay una panadería cercana en varias manzanas a la redonda, observando este hecho y gracias a su aguda mentalidad comercial instaló un pequeño horno artesanal de barro en las instalaciones de su casita con el propósito de elaborar una muy buena cantidad de panes, con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo en la atención diaria al público colindante a su domicilio; siempre preparan suficientes panes para cubrir la demanda de las personas que acostumbradas a degustar un delicioso pan acuden a la panadería de Marita.Debido al crecimiento de su negocio se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar los insumos para la elaboración de los deliciosos panes.Ayudemos a Marita a hacer crecer su negocio, ya que uno de sus deseos es tener la panadería bien implementada y con unidades de reparto para generar puestos de trabajo y contribuir con el desarrollo de su familia y la satisfacción de sus vecinos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to increase production and sales

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen B.. I am married and have five children, all of whom attend a local school. I live with my family in the small town Raiwind, Pakistan. My husband works at a factory for low wages, and I sell milk from my house. I would like  to buy another cow to increase production and increase my income. Please lend me $200.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (B) Group

texts.en: Christine owns a retail shop. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her shop

loans.name: Kireka A2(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Fiona N.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of shoes. Fiona is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a civil servant. She has 2 children, ages 5 and 7, both of whom go to school. Each week, Fiona makes approximately UGX 50000 (~ $30 USD) in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Fiona has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 400000 (~ $233 USD) to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Fiona is joined in her small group by Fatumah A., Margret N., Mary N., and Dorothy K.. Fatumah A. has a local brewery and wants to add to her brewery business. Margret N. sells roasted maize and wants a loan to buy more maize from the village to increase her stock. Mary N. operates a furniture shop and wants to expand her business. Dorothy K. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes and expand her business

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Mrs. Norm M. was married in 1983 and has five children; four sons and one daughter. 
All of her children are living under her custody and help her in doing business.

She has been in the business of buying and reselling small trees and flowering trees in the village. She began this business in 1983. Her husband is a soldier and gardener.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to buy more small trees and flowering trees for reselling.

loans.use: To buy more small trees and flowering trees for reselling

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine is a 22 year old young woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Sabrine makes handicrafts. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at A. Majmoua. She needs a loan to buy materiA. to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Gakuweebwa Munno Women's Group

texts.en: Christine N. is the chairperson of Gakuweebwa Munno women’s group in Lugazi. She has a 10-year-old business, a mobile shop, selling new clothes for men, women and children at daily markets locally termed as “mubuulo.” With this kind of business, men and women in the same trade contribute and hire a Fuso truck that moves them every day of the week to these markets. She buys her stock from Kampala, usually on Thursday and Saturday. She is happy with this business, though at times there are setbacks due to the changing seasons. But the business has kept her going, especially now that her husband works and stays in Kenya and she has to buy the food and cover other immediate needs at home. She has four children and cares for one orphan. Her dream is to see her children grow into responsible citizens.

loans.use: To buy more clothes from Kampala to sell

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia sells clothing by request in the different provinces. Her family is in Huaral and she receives the orders through them. When she travels to distribute the order, she takes advantage of the trip to bring small animals, such as ducks and guinea pigs, back to Lima. Obdulia has worked at this type of business her entire life.

For the past 3 years, she has also been a partner in a computer supplies business that her sister has in central Lima.

The loans she has requested have been used for working capital for her sister´s business and to buy the clothing she sells. Obdulia would like to open a store close to where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Obdulia se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos a provincia. Ella tiene familia en Huaral, por medio de ellos recibe los pedidos. Cuando viaja a repartir los pedidos, ella aprovecha y trae a Lima animales como patos o cuyes. Obdulia ha trabajado toda la vida en este tipo de negocio.

También es socia capitalista del negocio de artículos informáticos que su hermana tiene en el Centro de Lima, desde hace 3 años.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para poner el capital del negocio de su hermana, y para la compra de la ropa que ofrece. A Obdulia le gustaría abrir una tienda cerca de su casa.

loans.use: For working capital and to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz lives on Mirador street in Ventilla, a semi urban zone of El Alto. Due to family issues she separated from her husband and currently lives alone. Her husband lives with and supports the children.

Beatriz sells leather and hides from cattle and goats along the border with Peru. She works in this area because prices are higher. The requested loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise (hides). The market is stable, but the demand for the goods currently exceeds her supplies so she will surely increase her sales.

This is the seventh loan that Beatriz has requested from IMPRO. She has been a client since 2004 and has a good credit history. The evaluation completed by IMPRO approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, vive en la calle Mirador de la zona de Ventilla, zona peri urbana de ciudad de El Alto. Actualmente vive sola ya que por razones familiares se separo de su esposo quien se encarga de sus hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de cueros de vaca y chivos en la frontera con Perú, ya que su precio es más elevado en dicho sector. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más mercadería ( cueros de vaca y chivo) pues indica que la demanda por dichos productos excede su oferta actual y el mercado está asegurado y que definitivamente mejorarán sus ingresos. Es el séptimo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito. Beatriz es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: Purchase of additional cattle and goat hides to sell along the Peruvian border.

loans.name: Hudoyqul

texts.ru:
Hudoyqul H., 49, lives in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan. He and his wife have four children. Hudoyqul has a plot of land where he grows wheat. In order to prepare his land for the next planting, Hudoyqul would like to purchase seeds and fertilizer. To raise funds for the purchase, he has applied for a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанов Худойкул проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 49 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимется земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей. Для того, чтобы подготовить землю к повторному посеву, хочет закупить семена и удобрения. Для этого планирует получить кредит , сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
For 5 years now, Blanca has had a home daycare in her house. She has taken care of up to 7 children, although right now she only has 3.

Blanca greets the children in her home at 7:30 a.m. She takes care of them at night many times, since their parents have night obligations. In addition, for 17 years Blanca has rented out the second and third floors of her house.

The loans she has requested have been invested in buying a DVD player so the children can be entertained.

Blanca has plans to stop caring for children because of her delicate health. However, she would like to finish building the fourth floor of her house to be able to rent it out.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 5 años, Blanca se dedica al cuidado de niños en su casa. Ella ha llegado a cuidar hasta 7 niños, sin embargo en la actualidad solo tiene a 3.

Blanca recibe a los niños en su casa a las 7.30 de la mañana. Muchas veces ha tenido que cuidarlos en la noche, puesto que algunos papás tiene compromisos nocturnos. Asimismo, Blanca alquila el segundo y tercer piso de su casa desde hace 17 años.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en comprarse un DVD para que así los niños puedan entretenerse.

Blanca tiene en sus planes dejar de cuidar niños, ya que se encuentra delicada de salud. Por el contrario, desea terminar de construir el cuarto piso de su casa y así poder alquilarlo.

loans.use: buying a DVD player so the children to entertain the children (Para comprarse un DVD y así los niños puedan entretenerse.)

loans.name: Mrs. Chhuon Bun Chhoeurn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen members form this village bank [solidarity group] in Choeung Khnar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chhuon B. C. is the village bank president and owns a small restaurant where she can sell Chinese noodle and rice soup to the villagers and passersby. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients in order to cook the delicious food for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Seng Sophally, helps her when he has free time from his motorbike taxi business. Mrs. Chhuon B. C. is 52 years old and the mother of four children. Two of the children assist with their mother’s business, while the remaining two are attending the local school.

Mr. Phan S. did not come to take out his loan, but his wife did and is presented in the photo.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK [Kiva’s Field Partner] has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook delicious food for her customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, vive con sus dos hijas, Anira de 5 y Janet de 2. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza desde hace12 años, al divorciarse de su esposo y hacerse cargo de sus dos hijas. Realiza su trabajo los días de feria en su natal comunidad, llamada, Santa Lucia y en el distrito de Cabanillas, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, lo malo es que se le hace complicado el transporte del ganado a estas ferias, lo cual María a sabido sobrellevar muy bien, ya que a pesar de estos inconvenientes, le gusta lo que hace, poniéndole todas sus ganas y empeño. Esta madre quiere que sus hijas Anira y Janet sean profesionales y tengan mejores oportunidades, de las que tuvo ella. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará un ejemplar de ovino, para criar y luego vender a mayor precio, y así lograr mayores ingresos económicos.  En el futuro, María quiere que su negocio se incremente mucho más, teniendo mayor cantidad de ganado para vender.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives with her two daughters, Anira of age 5 and Janet of age 2. She makes a living by buying and selling cattle livestock, an activity that she has done for the past 12 years during which she divorced her husband and needed to support her children. She works on the days of the street market in her community, Santa Lucia, and in the Cabanillas district, where she makes good profits. The bad part is she has difficulty transporting the cattle to these markets but Maria has endured very well. Even though she has these inconveniences, she likes doing this job and devotes to it all of her willpower and effort. This mother wants her daughters, Anita and Jane, to be professionals and to have better opportunities than she did. With this loan, she will buy a high quality sheep to raise and later sell at a higher price that will provide her higher income. In the future, Maria wants her business to grow a lot and have a larger amount of livestock to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small sheep to raise and then sell

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Se dedica desD. hace 20 años a la agricultura, es natural del mismo lugar donD. vive, es así que todos los días ella y su familia trabajan intensamente en el cuidado D. sus animales,  llevándolos a pastizales, el trayecto les toma 2 horas D. duro caminar, ya casi al anochecer regresan para guardarlos en su establo y descansar. Cuando es época D. siembra la tarea del campo se torna más dura, por lo que hasta los más pequeños D. su casa apoyan en esta labor, el cultivo principal para Melania son los tubérculos y granos como la papa, oca, olluco, cebada, arveja, etc. ella utiliza el arado con los 2 toros que tiene, D. esa manera garantiza el sostenimiento D. su familia. Para Melania es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, es una mujer cumplidora en sus pagos, por lo que se la consideró en esta renovación D. crédito. Solicita este préstamo con el cual comprará sacos D. abono para preparar la tierra D. cultivo que posee.
texts.en:
Melania is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their children. She has worked in agriculture since the age of 20. She is a native of the same place that she lives, so every day she and her family work hard caring for animals and taking them to the pastures. The route takes them 2 hours to walk; it is almost nightfall when they return to put the animals in their stable and to rest. When it is sowing time, the farm work takes more time. As a result, even the youngest children help with this work. The main crops for Melania are the tubers and grains, like potatoes, oca, olluco, barley, peas, etc. She uses the plow with the 2 bulls that she has. In this way, she guarantees the sustenance of her family. This is Melania’s second loan from MFP. She is a woman who is compliant in her payments. Because of this, she was considered for another loan. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy sacks of fertilizer to prepare her land for the crops that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buys sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena M. sells fish, which she buys from fishermen, and brings them home for processing and preservation. She then sends them to the market for sale at Atonkwa near Elmina. Amena has received no formal education. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a sanitary officer. Mena has been selling fish since 2002.

She is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her trade in fish sales. She was frying fish when the picture was taken.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sovy Vann Villag Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four people living in Knong Preaek village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use their share of the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sovy V., the 32-year-old village bank president, is a fish seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. N. ME. Tech, is a waiter who can make only a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Sovy V. is the mother of a child who is enrolled in the local school.

One member in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth K. sells beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Elizerbeth is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a builder. She has 4 children who attend school. A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en Quechua.
Gladys es conviviente, tiene 29 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Gladys junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de venta de computadoras, accesorios de computadora, tarjetas de celulares, además brindan servicio técnico.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas para celulares.
Los sueños de Gladys son tener capital propio e implementar otro negocio que le genere mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the 'Llapanchik' Community Bank, which means 'everyone' in Quechua. Gladys is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and is expecting her first child. Gladys and her husband own a shop selling computers, computer accessories and cell phone recharge cards, as well as offering repair services. Gladys is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to purchase cell phone recharge cards. Her goals are to build up her own capital and start another business to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cell phone recharge cards

loans.name: Winston

texts.en:
Winston P. is a rice farmer. He tills and plows the field all the time to provide enough food for his family. He is 32 years old and has no children. His wife, Aileen P., helps him manage their rice farm. Aside from rice, he also grows ducks. Today he has 400 ducks on his farm. He started this business 12 years ago. He has a very strong entrepreneurial spirit and wants to grow his business more.

He is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. He will use the loan to buy more ducks as well as farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will definitely help Winston have a better yield on his farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help alleviate poverty. They help people start and have their own business. They provide not only provide credit but also training and insurance coverage to all their clients to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and ducks

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang S. is 56 years old. She makes a living growing morning glories at the public lakes in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. By selling her flowers each month, she earns $5 per day to cover her family's needs. Her husband works with her in the business. They have six children; five of them are married and live independently, while one still lives in the family home. S. is requesting a loan to support her business operations. She will use the money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pumps and insecticide to grow morning glories.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pumps and insecticide to grow morning glories.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
This medium-size shop located in Phnom Penh City belongs to Mrs. S., who provides a beauty-salon service to the neighbors. In the business, she can make an income of approximately of $4 a day to manage her family's daily needs. She is a widowed mother who cares for three children, who are all single and attend school.

S.'s investment has been running for a long time but the business still needs equipment. S. would like a $500 loan to purchase additional hairdressing tools for her beauty-salon service.

loans.use: To purchase additional hairdressing tools

loans.name: Rusuethe

texts.en:
"I experience working by a casual basis. I have work today but at the end of six months you will end my contract and have to find another job again", says Rusuethe A., 36-year old mother of two children. Now, she is managing a small parcel of rice farm. This is a better livelihood for her. From her harvest, she was able to feed and clothe her family as well as providing their other needs. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and crude oil to run farm tractors. She hopes that by doing so she will be able to improve her harvest.

CEVI gives not just loans. They also provide trainings and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and crude oil to run farm tractors.

loans.name: Khoudia Sall

texts.fr: KHOUDIA SALL D. est une jeune femme née à thies en 1980;elle exerce la  fonction de couturière depuis plus de sept ans ,elle a ouvert un atelier chez elle avec l'aide de son frère qui est enseignant;avec le financement qu'elle sollicite elle envisage de renforcer son petit commerce d'articles de mercerie et de produits cosmétiques
texts.en:
Khoudia Sall D. is a young woman born in Thies in 1980. She has been working as a seamstress for over seven years. She opened a workshop in her home with the help of her brother, who is a teacher. With the financing she’s requesting, she envisions bolstering her small business in sewing supplies and in cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A small business/ sewing supplies and cosmetic products

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish to residents in the local community. Fe has engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase fish to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her second taken by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

--------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wooden planks for resale

loans.name: Prisca's Group

texts.en: N. Prisca is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is 34 years old and married with seven children aged 17 – 6 years as she cares for her siblings. She is a strong business woman involved in the sale of agricultural produce for 8 years now. A brief background of her business is that she started very small with selling matooke as a retailer but now sells on wholesale to other people in the same business. Her biggest challenge is the scarcity of produce especially during bad seasons which hikes the prices of everything, but with the loans and availability of capital, all this becomes history. Her business centre is Kiyoola and she is able to make weekly profits of 80,000/= hence being able to meet her family needs and saving for her children’s education. Prisca needs a loan to help add more capital to her business by buying more matooke for resale.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Esmeralda De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora de Nombre Esmeralda de los Ángeles Velásquez R., tiene la edad de 31 años. Tiene 2 hijos. Su compañero de vida labora en una empresa llamada impelco. Sus deseos son de tener salud para seguir trabajando en este medio de sustento y que sus hijos sean personas de bien y tengan un futuro en el plano profesional. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años, ella inicia este negocio trabajando en una tienda en la que vendía cosméticos de oriflame y comenzó a esparcir mercadería de ropa y perfumes y así se dedica a la comercialización de estos productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo de prendas de vestir que son encargadas del extranjero. Cosméticos y calzado.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.en:
The “Victoire” or “Victory” Group is made up of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. They are all excited about receiving their firS. loan to expand their current businesses. The group has a wide range of businesses from charcoal to cosmetics and from clothing to small boutiques. Thelot K. is one of three representatives of the group. He is a 27-year-old husband and father to one child.

The hardworking young man is the owner of a small boutique that sells un-prepared food, cold drinks, and phone cards, as well as other household necessities. He plans on investing the loan in his current business and hopes to be able to sell in bulk one day. Higher volume sales would improve the economic conditions for himself and his family, which is a top priority. On behalf of Thelot, Victoire, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: rice, oil, drinks, phone cards

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard M. has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last 16 years.  He is 61 years old, married to Elizabeth and they have five adult children who are all working.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He is planning to buy more goats to rear and then slaughter them for sell later in the year during the festive seasons.  He wants to buy the goats now as they are also cheaper and he is preparing for the peak season.

He still plans to continue with his butcher shop as thats the only thing he has done for the last 16 years as a source of income.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: Buy more goat to rear before slaughtering them for sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn M. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Jenelyn is married. Jenelyn owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store. Her income is primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jenelyn is just starting this business and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jenelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Jenelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Jenelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Miss Ratana T., 28, has been a silk weaver since 2007. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ratana’s mother has been weaving silk and selling silk fabric since 1979. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces far away from her house. She hopes to continue expanding her business.

Hence, Ratana is requesting a loan of $500 to help provide capital for her mother to purchase more finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To help provide capital for her mother to purchase more finished silk fabrics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her café.

loans.name: Estrellas Uno Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: LAS ESTRELLAS UNO  fue fundado el 03 D. AGOSTO del 2008, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en un negocio. Se encuentra situado en el B/ SAN FRANCISCO NORTE. El grupo  esta en su 4to ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas; en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. bijouteria, comida, costura y sastreria, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi (durazno seco), venta D. helados, venta D. pan, pintado en tela; son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos. Las Señoras estan conformes D. trabajar con Emprender, porque aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, respeto y al mismo tiempo compartir con sus amigas y vecinas cada quincena. 			
La Sra.Sonia, es Presidenta del grupo, es socia antigua, es la presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento. La Sra. Sonia nacio  en Montegudo Chuquisaca, radica en Santa Cruz hace ya varios años. Ella se dedica a alquilar sillas y mesas D. plastico para fiestas y acontemientos sociales, ademas tambien venD. cds en su domicilio, lo que le da tiempo para atender a su familia mientras trabaja, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender es muy importante para ella.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. Ayuda al sustento D. su hogar con los ingresos que percibe.			
La Sra. Hortencia es socia antigua del Banco D. Emprendimiento Las Estrellas Uno. Nacio en Arani, Cochabamba, se dedica hace 8 años a la venta D. verduras en el Mercado Abasto ubicado en el 3er anillo, bijouteria y animales,  tambien  realiza labores D. casa mientras que su esposo trabaja como albañil en diferentes partes D. la ciudad. Ella es muy responsable dentro del grupo. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia y ademas D. considerarla que  es  responsable y cumplida en el grupo. La Sra. es unas D. las fundadoras del grupo y cliente muy antigua D. Emprender.			
La Sra. Silvia es socia del Banco D. Emprendimiento Las Estrellas Uno, se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesas todas las noches en su domicilio en el Barrio San Francisci Norte, frente a la parada D. los micros D. la Linea 5 por lo que aprovecha esto para vender  a los choferes D. esta linea, ella comienza su trabajo bien temprano cuando sale a comprar el pan y hamburguesas y lo que necesita para su venta; comienza vender a las 4:00 pm hasta las 10:00 pm, su trabajo mayormente es preparar y vender las hamburguesas en su domicilio. La Sra es fundadora en el grupo  y la  oportunidad que le brinda el Banco D. Emprendimiento Las Estrellas es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Estrellas Uno” was founded on August 3, 2008, as an initiative by a group of ladies who wanted to continue with their small businesses. The Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco Norte. The group is in its fourth loan cycle and consists of 10 people. The women of the group are involved in retail businesses selling costume jewelry, food, cosmetics, medicines, mocochinchi (a beverage maD. with dried peaches), ice cream, painted fabrics, as well as offering services such as sewing and tailoring. They need access to credit immediately. These ladies are happy to be working with Emprender because they have learned how to save and take on many responsibilities. At the same time, they respect one another and have time to catch up with their friends and neighbors every two weeks.

Sra. Sonia is the president of the Communal Bank and a long-time member. She was born in Montegudo Chuquisaca, but has lived in Santa Cruz for several years. Sonia rents out plastic chairs and tables for parties and social gatherings. She also sells CDs out of her home, which gives her time to look after her family while she is working. In addition to being a friendly a dynamic person, Sonia has demonstrated that she is one of the most accomplished and responsible members of the group. This opportunity that Emprender has provided is very important to her. As one of the leaders of the group, she has satisfied all of her payments. The income she earns allows her to maintain her household.

Sra. Hortencia is another long-time member of “Las Estrellas Uno” Communal Bank. She was born in Arani, Cochabamba. Hortencia has been selling vegetables for eight years at the Abasto Market in the third section where rings, costume jewelry, and animals are also sold. She takes care of the household duties while her husband works as a mason in different parts of the city. Hortencia is a very responsible member in her group. With the income she earns, she is able to support her family. She is considered to be one of the most responsible and accomplished members of the group. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and a long-time client of Emprender.

Sra. Silvia is a member of “Las Estrellas Uno” Communal Bank who sells hamburgers every night at her home in the neighborhood of San Francisco Norte. Her house is located in front of the bus stop for Route #5, so she is able to sell to all of the drivers. She begins her work early in the day when she leaves to go buy bread and meat that she needs for making hamburgers. Silvia begins selling at 4pm and ends at 10pm. Her work primarily consists of preparing and selling the hamburgers from her home. Silva is the founder of “Las Estrellas” group, which has provided many opportunities that have been very important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Joy Marion

texts.en:
Joy Marion A. is from the village of South Western Poblacion, Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is 20 years old. Joy Marion is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Joy Marion owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as shampoo, canned goods, sugar and other daily use products in the local community. Joy Marion has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy Marion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy Marion is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Joy Marion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeurn T. is 46 years old. She is a widow with three children. The elder child is 24 years old, while the second child is 20 and the youngest one is 17. Two of them are garment-factory workers and the other is a motorcycle taxi driver. Nowadays, they all live in Cheung Prey Bei village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Saroeurn T. is a farmer. The business of the third child has a problem because his motorbike is very old, which makes him use more money for petroleum T. support that motorbike. Mrs. Saroeurn T. requested a loan for a new motorbike for her child.

loans.use: A new motorbike for her son's business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: M. Jane is a promising business lady of 28 years old, married with 3 children. She sells clothes and she has been running her business for over 5 years. She is using the loan to purchase clothing such as dresses, skirts, blouses, and so forth for sale. She hopes for business improvement. Her future plan is to work very hard and establish another boutique.

loans.use: To purchase clothes such as dresses, skirts, blouses, and so forth for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 25 years old and has been operating a transport business in Naivasha town since 2008. His mode of transport is the bicycle, known as boda boda here, which is a cheaper option to the motorcycle.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan from the organisation. He plans to venture into livestock farming as a secondary income generating business, thus he plans to use the money to buy two bulls and ten goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

His future ambition is to grow the livestock business and become a big supplier of both cattle and goat meat meat in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 2 Bulls and 10 goats to start livestock farming.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: N. Florence est née vers 1978. Il y a 6 ans que Florence s’est installée au quartier Dodji Dangban à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique. Mariée à CODJIA Ulrich, un brodeur, Florence est mère de cinq enfants, tous à sa charge. Florence n’a jamais fréquenté l’école, mais tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Florence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Florence est une couturière. Florence vend également dans son atelier de couture, des articles de mercerie (fils à coudre, des fermetures, des boutons, etc.). Florence a trois ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Florence est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Elle a bien remboursé le premier crédit et sollicite un autre crédit pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Florence N. was born around 1978. Six years ago she settled down in the Dodji Dangban district of Allada, a town in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. Married to Ulrich CODJA, an embroiderer, Florence has five children, all of whom are in her care. Florence has never been to school but all her children attend school. She lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. In order to provide for her needs, Florence sells haberdashery supplies at the market in Sékou. At the same time she is also a seamstress. Florence has three years of experience in this domain and gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is on her second loan from ALIDé. She repaid the first loan without incident and is applying for another loan to strengthen her business and increase her profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies, zippers, button, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is one of the very good members of ASHI in San Jose, a province of Antique. She was able to purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for her husband to manage and earn his daily income. The vehicle is for hire and is one of the common means of transporting people around the town and around the province. Just like with other unemployed men in town, this has become the main business of Gloria’s husband. It is the main source of income for Gloria’s family to support their needs, especially the education of her only 14-year-old child who is presently in high school. 

Because the motorcycle needs to be maintained (the strength of its engine is already depreciating after it was bought several years ago), Gloria is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI to be spent for reconditioning the motorcycle as well as its sidecar to be able to attract more passengers. This means that some spare parts have to be changed and the engine has to be cleaned.

loans.use: To recondition their motorcycle and sidecar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mwitu

texts.en:
Mwitu J. is a 45-year-old married mother of five children. She operates a food kiosk in Bamburi, Mombasa and has been in the business now for two years.

Mwitu joined KADET recently and is accessing her first loan. She was introduced by a fellow member in the group. With this loan, Mwitu plans to set up a water kiosk in the area and to purchase foodstuffs for the kiosk. Her main customers are residents of the Bamburi area. She hopes to become a very successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To set up a water kiosk and to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a fifty-five-year-old man who lives with his wife and their two children. Ghassan has been operating a photography shop for over fifteen years. He does professional pictures for individuals or events. He is an active and working man, and he does his best to improve his financial situation. In order to provide the best for his family, he works early in the morning until late in the evening, and he tries his best not to miss an occasion for photography. 

Today, for the first time, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tapes, a digital camera, and more. 

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he did not have many clients because he was not known by the public, but he knew how to enlarge his networking.

loans.use: To purchase tapes, a digital camera, and more.

loans.name: Josefina Enriqueta

texts.es: Josefina Enriqueta F. M., vive en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su nieto de 19 años de edad, quien trabaja como cobrador del transporte público, y el cual es su única compañía. A sus 63 años de edad, la señora Josefina posee una tortillería la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual se encarga de elaborar tortillas todos los días de la semana en cada mediodía. Josefina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor para comprarlo a precio más bajo y de esta manera contar con más cantidad de materia prima para elaborar más tortillas. Josefina es una señora muy amable y alegre quien siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante y contar con todo lo necesario para contar con una vida estable.
texts.en:
Josefina Enriqueta F. M. lives in the town of Soyapango with her 19 year old grandson, who works as a bus fare collector and keeps her company. At 63 years of age, Sra. Josefina has a tortilla shop in her home where she is responsible for making tortillas every day of the week at noon.

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk so that she can obtain a lower price and acquire a large quantity of the supplies needed to make more tortillas. She is a kind and cheerful lady who always strives to get ahead and gain everything she needs to have a stable life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: Lucia Isabel

texts.es: Lucia es de 33 años de edad, es soltera, se dedica a la elaboración de fajas típicas para vestir, la actividad tiene 7 años de estarlo realizando, solicita su segundo crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo, específicamente para comprar  hilo y material para elaborar fajas, su primer préstamo lo pago sin problema, su producto lo vende en la plaza del mercado local y lugares aledaños el préstamo le será de mucho apoyo.
texts.en:
Lucia is 33 years old, single, and produces sashes to be worn. She has been in this business for seven years and is requesting her second loan so that she can increase her operating capital. Specifically, she will buy thread and material for making sashes. Her first loan was repaid without any problems. Her products are sold in the plaza of the local market and in surrounding areas. This loan will be very helpful.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread & materials for making sashes

loans.name: Akouavi Claudine

texts.en:
Madame Akouavi S. is 40 years old and owns a general store in her home town of Lomé, Togo. She's had her store for about two years. She is married to a taxi driver and they have three children.

Madame S. has requested a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store. This 300,000 CFA loan will fortify her working capital and allow her to buy more products that her clients request.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Bertoli

texts.es: Bertoli L. Q., tiene la edad de 53 años, es soltero y vive solo. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de pescado para su venta.  La idea es comprar variedad de tipos de pescado y así poder venderlo a un precio mayor y obtener una ganancia. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Bertoli tiene algunos años en este negocio y espera aumentar sus ventas y seguir creciendo como comerciante. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Bertoli L. Q. is 53 years old, single, and lives by himself. He is requesting this loan to buy fish to sell. The idea is to buy a variety of types of fish, so he can sell them at a better price and make a profit. This is the first time he is taking out a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services they offer. Mr. Bertoli has been working in this business for several years and he hopes to increase his sales and to keep growing as a businessman. He dreams of a better future, with a higher quality of life and greater economic stability, and he would like to continue to grow as a person and as a businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Muon

texts.en: Mrs. Muon N. has been spending her life growing crops. Muon N. needs money to use on the farm during the coming rainfall, which is good for farming. She is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.  Muon N. currently lives with her husband who works in the farm fields frequently alongside her and they both have three school-aged kids.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds

loans.name: Batool Azra's Group

texts.en:
Batool Azra lives in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Vehari. She is a 57-year-old lady who lives in a small house with her family. She has given birth to a daughter who is now married. She is also a grandmother of her daughter’s daughter, who is 13 years old and reads in 7th standard.  

Batool has spent her life serving her family. She is a housewife, staying at home and carrying out the responsibilities of a housewife and a mother very well.  

Her husband's name is J. and he has a business of selling water-filter sets. He purchases water filters from the electronics shop and sells them to the local markets of his native city. He has been doing this business for the last 15 years. 

Batool has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy the water-filter sets and sell them to different electronic shops. 

She is hopeful that this investment will help her husband to improve his business conditions and to earn more profit. This is the first time Batool has applied for a loan with any microfinance institution (MFI) and she wants to build a long-term relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase water-filter sets for reselling

loans.name: John

texts.es: John, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Con muchas ganas de trabajar John sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente sembríos de papa, arveja y maíz, productos que son rápidamente comprados en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de los insectos. En adelante, espera que su producción mejore, ya que de eso dependen sus ingresos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan más.
texts.en:
John is 21 years old and is very easy-going and hard-working. He lives with his parents and what he wants most is to improve their quality of life. He is very eager to work and goes every day to cultivate his land. He mainly grows potatoes, peas and corn. These products sell quickly in the Tarma market due to their good quality. The thing that he likes most about this work is cultivating the land. He has been doing this for a year now and what he considers most difficult is protecting his land from insects. In the future, he hopes that his production improves since he depends on this for income. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to have obtained it and will make his payments on time. He is well-liked in his communal bank. With the 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that he is requesting he will buy fertilizer for his farms because he wants to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria S., from the village of Namabbalan Norte, Tuguegarao City, is 51 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria has been raising pigs for fattening and sale for over 5 years, earning approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials needed for the production of polvoron, pastries and biscuits

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian lives with his partner and their daughter in the village of Chacupe Alto in the district of La Victoria. Sebastian is 25 years old. The area of his village is small and rural. The majority of the residents manage small farms, raising cattle or birds. Sebastian’s home has electricity and also access to water, which is harvested from a local well.

During the day Sebastian is a field laborer. He has been working in various agricultural activities for over 15 years. In the afternoon, Sebastian drives a moto-taxi in the area, carrying passengers to and from work, stores or other locations. This moto-taxi is owned by his father; he rents it from him for a reasonable fee.

Recently, Sebastian has contracted to rent half a hectare of land in order to plant camote (a type of sweet potato). He is requesting this loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, urea and other inputs for the production of the crop. He hopes that this planting will provide a good profit for his family and further supplement their needs. He is proud to be raising his own crops and building his own capital.

loans.use: Buy seed, fertilizer and other products to plant camote (sweet potato)

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal T. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Senglay Kroeung, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1990 and have two daughters. 

Sophal is a silk weaver. In the past, she ran a grocery store. She is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica al negocio de taller mecánica, el arregla diferentes carros, el trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para arreglar los carros.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan, 33, is a member of the “LOS LIDERES” (The Leaders) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single and has two children.  He is a mechanic.  He repairs different cars working from 8am until 6pm.  He wants to expand and improve the business and is asking for a loan to buy replacement parts to repair cars.

He thanks all those who will share in his dream through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia lives in Lahore, a historic city in the Punjab province of Pakistan.  The area is known for its culture and history. She lives with her family in a two-room, brick house in an area named Fareed Town. 

Her husband’s name is K. J. and he is a tailor by profession. He operates his tailoring shop, where he sews men’s clothes, in the market.  Nazia lives in a combined family system. Her brother-in-law lives in the same house and contributes financially to the family by doing labor work. 

Nazia is a seamstress and sews to supplement the family's income. She mainly receives orders from her neighbors.  She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of the children are studying at a local school.  

She is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine and hire a worker, which will help him to offer better services to his clients and fulfill larger orders on-time. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, Nazia is the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and hire an employee for a tailoring business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby L. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Ruby is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service like nail polish. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nail polish

loans.name: Estelita's Group

texts.en:
