Estelita C. is from the village of San Andes. She is 48 years old. Estelita is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Estelita C. group.

Estelita is married and has 1 adult-aged child. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Estelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2005, Estelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Estelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Salwa

texts.ar:
سلوى في عمر 47 سنة عزباء تعمل في خياطة الالبسة لها في عملها 15 سنة تحب عملها وتريد التطور التجدد في العمل 
تلحم دائما ببناء مستقبل جيد فهي تطمح بفتح محل خاص لها وان تكون من اصحاب المدخول الجيد فهي دائمة الطموح
والمثابرة في العمل تتميز بالدقة والصدق في المعاملة وملاحقة كل ما هو جديد تتلقى دائما الدعم من عائلتها فهي
تدعمها دائما لكنها تلقى بعض الصعوبة في زيادة البضائع لديها تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء عطورات
واكسسوارات حتى تزيد من مدخولها
texts.en: Salwa is 47 years old and single and has been working as a sewing professionA. for the past fifteen years. She is very ardent and involved in her work and conscientious with her patrons. Furthermore, she always follows the latest trends. Salwa dreams of one day opening her own store and securing a respectable income. For now, she spends what money she has on her family, who support her very much. Since she is having difficulty finding the resources to procure more merchandise, Salwa has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase perfumes and other accessories for women.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and other accessories for women

loans.name: Megzem

texts.en:
Mrs. Megzem G., 24 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple is newly wed and currently they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on Megzem’s brother’s piece of land. They are planning to buy a piece of land in the near future. Megzem’s husband works for a private company as a truck driver.

Megzem rents an area inside a small shop, where she sells fruits and vegetables. Megzem is an accountant; however, she could not find a job in her specialization. Her profession helps a lot in her business. She buys her products from the Narantuul wholesale market, where she has contracted suppliers. Due to the approaching Lunar New Year’s celebration, Megzem is planning to increase her sales by increasing her stock and variety of products.

loans.use: to increase her stock and product variety for the Lunar New Year's celebration

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Kang C. has been farming for years in Kompong Chhnang. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband earns a living selling firewood and cows. He always purchases cows from other farmers in and around his village and resells them for profit. In order to stimulate her husband’s business, Kang C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy many cows at reasonable prices for future sales.

loans.use: to buy many cows at reasonable prices

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Jalia has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food at home.  In the future, Jalia hopes to own a plot of land. Jalia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business by getting enough working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Kolotomo, dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de matériels agricoles (daba et houe), de galettes à base de mil et du lait. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire. Tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Madame Ramata D.  qui est connue dans le village pour sa vente de céréales, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 sacs de mil avec les forains des villages environnants de Ségou petit à petit. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Ramata D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité à travers ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The six women of the group Tièssiri are married and living mostly in monogamous households. They average 43 years of age and four children each, and they live in the village of Kolotomo, in the rural commune of Pelengana, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of marriage, community, and kinship. The group members have small-scale businesses involving farming equipment (daba and hoes) and pancakes made from millet and milk.   Needing to increase their working capital and to be resupplied with cash, the group members joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan cycle. The five previous loans have all been repaid without any difficulties at all. Ms. Ramata D., who is known in the village for selling grains, plans on using her loan to buy 7 sacks of millet little by little from market vendors of villages around Ségou. Retail sales are made by cash or credit at the house. Her customer base comprise women and men. With this loan, Ms. Ramata D. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and for meeting the needs of the young ones at home. Her goal is to increase her business volume through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Saida Del Carmen

texts.es: Saida Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos se siente muy contenta ya que han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios, con el propósito de apoyar a su compañero de vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de su medio de vida pues la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes y adolecentes. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsos, ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado, sabanas, prendas entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en: Saida Del Carmen works selling general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 7 years. This is not the first time she has received financing, and she feels very pleased that they have been of such great help to her business. She started this business with her own money, with the intention of helping her life partner. She is a very hardworking person and enjoys her way of life since the majority of her customers are young adolescents. She is requesting this loan to purchase purses, clothing, cosmetics, footwear, linens, and undergarments among other necessary products.

loans.use: to purchase purses, clothing, cosmetics, footwear, linens, and undergarments

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: El señor Justino es chofer. Con el dinero del préstamo comprara material de construcción como arena, cemento, ladrillos. El cliente desea construir el muro frontal y colocar el garaje. Vive en casa propia el cual esta ubicado en la zona San Martín de la ciudad de  La Paz. Es casado y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en: Mr. Justino is a driver.  With the loan proceeds he will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, bricks.  The client wants to build a front wall and set up a garage.  He lives in his own house located in the San Martin area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Sonia P. works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business. 

Sonia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig-fattening business.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, pues ha sido beneficioso para su familia ya que ha podido generar ingresos diarios a su hogar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, refrescos, papel, enlatados y sopas.  La ubicación de su actividad es en su vivienda. Siempre ha soñado con ampliar su negocio cada día más y generar ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en: Ms. Maria De Los Angeles has been running a general store for over 5 years, and it has been of great benefit for her family because she has been able to earn a daily income for the household. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase staple grains, detergent, candy, bread, beverages, paper, canned goods, and soups. This business is located in her home. She has always dreamt of expanding her business each day and of generating profits for her household.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, detergent, candy, bread, beverages, paper, canned goods, and soups.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong, 33, is a resident of Siem Reap Province. He is a domestic farmer and earns an average of $4 a day. He is married to Mrs. Saroun, 30, who is also a farmer.  They have three school-aged children. Mr. Kong used to raise pigs in the past but had to stop that activity due to financial problems faced by his family. He now hopes to return to this business by using a Kiva loan to buy pig feed and piglets for breeding. This will provide him with additional income which he will use to better meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. Violeta has a business raising pigs and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month.

Violeta has been a member of PMPC for two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of pig feed. In the future, Violeta hopes to use the extra money from her business for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Manhal

texts.en:
ManhA., a 30-year old unmarriied entrepreneur from Lebanon, has operated an auto repair service for the past six years ago. His 14 years of experience in the field have enabled him to provide high-quality service, and he counts among his many customers friends and other community members.

ManhA. is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to buy tools necessary for his business. He hopes to expand his work and improve all of his machines.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary for his business.

loans.name: Celidonia

texts.en:
Celidonia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Celidonia has a retail shop that sells furniture such as dining tables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for making furniture.

Celidonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Celidonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making furniture

loans.name: Florindo

texts.es: Florindo, tiene la edad de 65 años, está casada, vive con su hijo, su esposa y un hermano. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una vaca de leche. El quiere con esta compra generar la leche para el autoconsumo del hogar. El quiere con esto tener menos egresos y así poder generar más bienestar para su familia. El con la leche que no se consuma le venderá para así generar dinero para su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Florindo is 65, married, and lives with his son, wife and brother.  He seeks this credit to buy a milking cow, to provide for the needs of his household.  Any excess production will be sold, in order to provide modest income for his family.  This is his first credit with FUDECOSUR, and he is pleased that this lender has given him favorable terms and a much lower interest rate than commercial or state banks.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is from the village of Napareuli. He is 49 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents. Both of Gia’s parents are retired. 

Gia owns a truck (a Kamaz 5410) and works mainly in the transportation of construction materials. He has hired a driver and pays him 30 percent of the total income. Also, he has 2 hectares of land, where he grows maize. Harvested maize is sold locally. The total average monthly income of the family, including his parents’ pensions, is 1,050 Laris. 

Gia’s truck is out of order at the moment, and he has to change some parts of it. He requested credit for purchasing an accumulator and a tire cover for the truck. After he changes of the above-mentioned parts, he will continue working. 

In the future, Gia plans to make some savings, sell the existing truck and purchase a more modern one.

loans.use: to purchase an accumulator and a tire cover for the truck.

loans.name: Evonny

texts.en:
Evonny is 24 years old and married, with 2 children.  Evonny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal & firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal & firewood to sell.

Evonny has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 4 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.  Evonny aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal & firewood to sell

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Aura Elena tiene 45 años esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento, por lo que ha sido muy importante para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de leña y ropa. Hace más de trece año que tiene este negocio a pesar de ser una persona muy humilde ha sabido enfrentar las circunstancias que se le han enfrentado. El objetivo del préstamo es para comprar una gran cantidad de leña y una pequeña cantidad de ropa.
texts.en:
Aura Elena is 45 years old and this is not the first time she has obtained a loan. Such loans have proven to be very important for the advancement of her family. Aura is dedicated to selling firewood and clothing. For more than 13 years she has been in this business. Though she is a very humble person, she has been able to confront the circumstances that have faced her. 

The object of this loan is to buy a large quantity of firewood and a small quantity of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of firewood and a small quantity of clothing, to sell both.

loans.name: Octavio Washington

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.

En este lugar conocimos a don Octavio, tiene 59 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun vive en su casa, una de sus hijas acaba de dar a luz y nuestro amigo está muy contento por aquello. Su esposa es ama de casa.

El es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que siempre y con mucho esfuerzo ha tratado de que no falte nada en su hogar,  se dedica a la compra y venta de  de adornos y cerámicas,  su forma de venta es ambulante a veces se desplaza a otras ciudades llevando sus productos que son muy apreciados en la en todo el país,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Sus productos los compran a artesanos en La Pila, nuestro amigo lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y siempre le ha ido bien ya que cuenta con buena clientela.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos  y le gusta los créditos y sus compañeras que son muy unidas y amables. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
La Pila Communal Bank meets every two weeks in La Pila, in Montecristi Canton.  This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  Here you can find a wide variety of handicrafts made by residents following the customs of their ancestors.

Here we met Octavio, 59, who is married and has four adult children with his wife.  Two of his children still live at home.  One of his daughters just had a baby and our friend is very happy about that.  His wife is a homemaker.

Octavio is a very responsible and hardworking man who always and with great effort has tried to make sure that nothing is lacking in his home.  He buys and sells decorations and ceramics.  He sells on foot, and sometimes he goes to other cities with his products, which are highly valued throughout the country.  He works every day from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  He buys his products from artisans in La Pila.  Our friend has worked in this business for more than 20 years and he always has done well because he has a good clientele.

This loan is to buy more handicrafts of all types to stock his business.  Octavio has been in the communal bank for four cycles and he likes the loans and his colleagues, who are very united and nice.

His dream is to have good health to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Wakoritho Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school. She has been running a beauty salon since 2007.  She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a dryer, salon equipment and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to open another salon.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wakoritho", which has 25 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: Ruth Meri

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Mery; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una clínica dental, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante, la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo en una clínica dental. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su casa para comprar un artefacto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to communal bank "Banco del Desarrollo" ("Bank of Development"). It is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.
The member is Ruth Mery, who is 31 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with her job at a dental clinic. The member works from 8am to 7pm and through her work she wants to get ahead. She wants to do better at her job in a dental clinic.
The member requests the loan to purchase a household appliance to set up her home.
She is happy to get the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase a household appliance to set up her home.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья с мужем и двумя детьми живет в небольшом селе Великая Знаменка. Она – предприниматель сельскохозяйственник, занимается выращиванием ранних овощей: помидоров, редиса, капусты и перца. Наталья владеет двумя большими участками земли, всего 1 гектар. У нее – 3 больших теплицы и 30 маленьких. Наталья занимается выращиванием овощей уже 14 лет. В хозяйство у нее вложено 200 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на пленку составляют 51 000 гривен.  

Наталья планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен в установку отопительного оборудования в двух больших теплицах, а также в приобретение пленки. Это даст возможность раньше высаживать помидоры и соответственно продавать их по более выгодной цене. В тепле помидоры будут меньше болеть и дадут большой и более качественный урожай, что поможет Наталье получить хороший доход в следующей сезоне. У Натальи очень много земли, есть куда развиваться. В будущем ее семья планирует использовать полученную прибыль для того, чтобы сделать пристройку в доме и расширить жилплощадь. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Natalya and her husband with two children live in the small village of Velikaya Znamenka. She is a farmer-entrepreneur, she grows early vegetables such as tomatoes, radish, cabbage and peppers. Natalya owns two large plots of land totaling 1 hectare. She has three large and 30 small greenhouses. Natalya has been growing vegetables for fourteen years. She has 200,000 hryvna invested in her business. The yearly expense on film is 51,000 hryvna.

Natalya plans to invest the loan from Kiva in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to install heating equipment in two large greenhouses and also buy film. This will allow to her to plant tomatoes earlier and then sell them at a more profitable price. The tomatoes will have less disease in warmth and the harvest will be of better quality which will help Natalya receive a good profit in the next season. She has a lot of land so there's room for growth. In the future her family plans to use the profit to build an addition to the house and expand the dwelling space.

loans.use: to invest the 15,000 hryvna Kiva loan to install heading equipment in two large greenhouses and also purchase film.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a single parent taking care of five children. She has received a junior high education. Eunice sells cooking utensils. She is a hairdresser by profession. Her business is just four years old and she wants to increase the sale of utensils by procuring other types of utensils to resell. Any profit that will be realized as a result of the loan will be used to revive the hairdressing business.

loans.use: to buy other types of utensils to sell.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
At 38 years old, Marcelo manages a small farm in his village. He finished elementary grade then ended up in farming. He needs to patiently till his farm in order to provide for his big family. He needs to ask for assistance from Kiva, requesting a loan amount of 25,000 Philippines pesos (P) to buy corn, fertilizers and insecticides to apply to his corn field.

These inputs will greatly affect his farming for the better. His income from farming will be saved for the education of his children as well as for the improvement of his business production.

loans.use: to buy corn, fertilizers and insecticides used in his corn field.

loans.name: Umedchon

texts.ru: Умедчон житель города Истаравшан. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена занимается шитьем. Умедчон таксист. Он занимается развозкой людей по городу а также иногда он возит пассажиров по маршруту Истаравшан – Душанбе. Умедчон берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Umedchon is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 29 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is involved in sewing.  Umedchon is a taxi driver.  He is involved in transporting people within the city and sometimes drives passengers along the Istaravshan - Dushanbe route.  Umedchon is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car, so that he can provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Espori Mi Bankito, vive por la comunidad de Nabon en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de vegetación y hermosos paisajes donde se respira un aire de paz y tranquilidad, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos viajan diariamente a la ciudad para ejercer diferentes actividades laborales. 

La Señora. María tiene 45 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos de 24, 22, 18, 16, 13, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan para sus gastos personales, su tercer y quinto hijo estudian en un colegio, su cuarto hijo estudia en el colegio y también trabaja, sus dos últimos hijos está estudiando en la escuela. La casa en la que vive es propia. 

Ella diariamente viaja de su comunidad a la ciudad para la atención de su negocio ya que es comerciante de mariscos, en esta actividad labora hace 13 años, trabaja todos los días de domingo a domingo y su horario de trabajo es de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mariscos como pescado, camarón, langostinos, conchas, etc. para continuar con esta actividad.
 
Sus metas son agrandar su casa y construir un taller de mecánica industrial para que sus hijos laboren en un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a member of the community bank "Espori Mi Bankito." She lives in the community of Nabon in the city of Cuenca, a place that is surrounded by vegetation and beautiful landscapes and where they breathe the air of peace and tranquility. Its people work in farming and raising animals. Many travel to the city every day to perform different types of work.

Señora Maria is 45 years old. She is the single mother of children ages 24, 22, 18, 16, 13, 10, and 8. Her two oldest children work to cover their personal expenses. Her third and fifth children are in secondary school, and her fourth is in secondary school and also works. Her two youngest children are in primary school. The house in which she lives is her own.

Every day she travels from her community to the city for her business, since she sells seafood. She has worked in this business for 13 years. She works every day of the week, and her working hours are from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening.

She is in her third loan cycle in her community bank, and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of seafood such as fish, shrimp, lobsters, oysters, etc., so that she can continue with this business.

Her goals are to enlarge her house and to construct an industrial mechanical workshop so that her sons can work in their own business.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, lobsters, oysters, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has been a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya for the last five years. Her farm produces potatoes, cabbages and carrots for the local market.

She is married with one child, aged 4, with herself being 32. She has one farmhand. She also runs a second-hand clothes business. 

Catherine has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and expand her farming into poultry farming. She wants to use the income to repay the loan and improve her family's living standards. She adds that she will, in the future, venture into wheat farming once she has established her dairy and poultry businesses.

She laments pest damage on their produce and the lack of finances.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where she lives with her family of 8 adult children.She is aged 62 and has been in active farming for over 20 years with her farm currently producing poultry and milk for the local market. Her farm is currently manned by two farmhands.

Esther has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her boost both her poultry and dairy business. She will use 30,000 KES to build a modern dairy unit and the other 30,000 KES to buy more poultry birds. She aspires to rank among the major suppliers of both dairy and poultry product in the entire North Rift region of Kenya.

She laments of high costs of feeds and high fluctuation of farm produce prices within the local markets

loans.use: To buy poultry and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 25 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Heidy de 03 años, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. El puesto de ventas de  María, es una de las más concurridas en el mercado de Kimbiri, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por los pobladores, quienes realizan  sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus consumidores sobre la calidad y variedad de cada producto, lleva 03 meses en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda en espera de clientes ya que de eso depende sus ingresos económicos gracias a la venta de sus mercaderías María. Para el bien de su marcha  solicita el crédito para poder comprar las suministros necesarias para su puesto de ventas.  Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir prosperando. En su banco comunal es una socia participe.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
María, age 25, is a single mother who lives in a rented house with her beloved three-year-old daughter Heidy. She wants to provide her daughter a better future. Her vending post is one of the busiest spots at the market in Kimbiri. María is preferred by her customers because of her great charisma and the friendly service that she offers. Her customers make their purchases very early because they know when her business opens and the final moment before she closes. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers about the quality and variety of each of her products. María has been in business for three months and considers the most difficult part to be spending all day at her shop waiting on her customers. However, she knows that her income is dependent on the merchandise they buy from her. For the sake of keeping her business in operation, María is requesting a loan to buy the necessary merchandise for her vending post.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is very pleased to know that she has the support of the Kiva lenders to help her continue prospering. In her Communal Bank, María is an active participant. Her loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy more provisions for her store such as sacks of rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Twifashe Group

texts.fr:
Jacinthe fait partie du groupe Twifashe.  Elle habite à Gitega,  est âgée de 22 ans. Elle est mariée à Alexis, commerçant des beignets. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfants, âgé de 2 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de beignets depuis 3 ans.

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de farine pour préparer beaucoup de beignets à vendre,afin de gagner plus. 

Le crédit lui permettra de bien nourrir sa famille, payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants, et assurer les soins de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacinthe, age 22, is a member of Twifashe Group. She lives in Gitega and is married to Alexis, who sells doughnuts. Together, they have one child, who is two years old. Jacinthe has been selling doughnuts for three years.

She's seeking her fifth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. She will use it to bolster her working capital and purchase a large quantity of flour to make lots of doughnuts to sell, in order to increase her profits.

The loan will enable her to feed her family and pay the school expenses of her children and healthcare costs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of flour to make doughnuts

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old with 3 children. She lives in Hioma,Uganda. Susan owns a depot where she sells beer and soda (soft drinks). She started her business with capital of one million shillings and now has worth of five million shillings. She wishes to diversify her business and expand to new markets. 

Susan faces the challenges of high price fluctuations and high fuel costs. She intends to use the loan to beers and sodas for sell. 

Susan's personal goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Sigit

texts.en:
Sigit is a good boy which come from Mande, he is a student in Pasundan 2 Vocational High School.
He has dream for be a mechanic. because he's very interesting to the auto world, so he choose be a mechanic. so thanks to komdia and of course to the KIVA.

loans.use: To Pay For School Costs.

loans.name: Leonidas Del Carmen

texts.es: Don Leónidas es un señor que lucha a diario trabajando en su taxi por muchos años, labor que le ha permitido mantener a su esposa e hijos los que ahora son independientes, ha invertido en su casa y con el último crédito logro construir el porche, ahora nuevamente solicita el apoyo de crédito en esta ocasión para realizar una división de cuarto que permitirá una mejor organización dentro de su vivienda.

loans.use: Don Leónidas solicita el crédito para continuar con la organización de su vivienda, que le permitirá una mejor calidad de vida, razón por el cual solicita el crédito.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: HELLO Kiva lenders! Meet Emily, a mother of two lovely children aged 13 and 7. Emily is based in Kimaring, a remote village in the rich highland areas of Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area is known for producing the best milk and their staple food is “mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. Emily has been practicing mixed farming for the past 4 years and she has made great strides in terms of profit margins. This small scale farmer generates income through selling milk, poultry, crops and some personal business that she does, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it. She passionately loves poultry farming and the best part is when she wakes up every morning to collect eggs. The main challenge facing Emily is the constant perennial shortages of eggs and poultry products in her village and local market. She seeks to change this through borrowing a loan and buying more poultry. Emily is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. With the loan, Emily will increase her income through selling eggs, poultry meat and also poultry feathers. The demand for poultry products in Kapsowar area is very high and through the loan she will be able to satisfy the demand. Other than profits from poultry farming, she will also benefit from poultry manure, hence saving money that would have been used in purchasing fertilizers. The additional income from this expansion will permanently change her life and improve her living conditions. Emily waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Jeannine Faramalala

texts.fr:
Jeannine a 50 ans, elle est veuve. Elle bénéficie d’une pension mensuelle. Elle a deux enfants de 19 et 12 ans dont l’un poursuit ses études à l’université et l’autre en classe de troisième  dans une école privée (paiement d’écolage pour les deux enfants) . 
Jeannine a comme activité l’aviculture: élevage de poulets  de chair, et élevage de poules pondeuses.  Le premier prêt a été investi dans les deux activités. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’une formation auprès d’AGRIFORM  en matière d’élevage. Elle dispose d’un guide d’élevage. Elle dispose également d’une année d’expérience dans l’élevage canards. 
La famille vit dans une maison héritée de ses parents. Elle prévoit de développer l’élevage dans le but de pouvoir assurer la continuité et réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études.

loans.use: acheter 25 têtes de poules pondeuses

loans.name: Abra

texts.en:
Mrs. Abra N., an orphan, is married with no children but has charge of three children from her sister, who died two years ago. Her long-unemployed husband has not really managed to provide for his family. And so Mrs. N. feels that the entire weight of her family rests on her shoulders. But because she has a business selling grain, she is doing the best she can to ensure that the basic needs of her family are met. With a high school education, she figured out how to develop her business. And she manages it rigorously ever since obtaining two micro-credit loans, which she has paid off without difficulty. This demonstrates her honesty and dependability.

Mrs. N. is reqeusting a $900 loan to lease a larger store for holding major stocks of grain. This will increase her income and will of course noticeably improve the living conditions of her family, whose is currently living a difficult life.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Madame N. Abra, orpheline de père et de mère, est mariée sans enfant mais à en charge trois enfants de sa grande sœur décédée il y a 2 ans. Son mari, en chômage continu, n’arrive pas réellement à subvenir aux besoins de son foyer. De ce fait, tout le poids de la famille repose sur elle. Mais, grâce à son activité de vente de céréales, elle arrive tant bien que mal à assurer les charges élémentaires de la famille. Avec le niveau du cours secondaire, elle a su développer son activité qu’elle gère avec rigueur à partir des deux microcrédits obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Ce qui démontre son honnêteté et la confiance que l’on peut lui faire.

Madame N. Abra sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $900 qui servira à louer un magasin plus grand et à faire un stock important de céréales. Ce qui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto, d’améliorer sensiblement les conditions de vie pénible que connaît sa famille aujourd’hui.

loans.use: to rent a bigger warehouse and to make an important storage of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace intends to purchase two more piglets

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso has 25 years of experience in his business. He began working for another person, who taught him his trade. Later, little by little with his savings he decided to open his own business and began to have his own customers. His works consists of buying furniture and providing the finishing touches, leaving the furniture looking beautiful. He works everyday of the week in his house: people also contract him to work on location: his hours of business are 8am-6pm.

Narciso would like credit in order to invest the money in buying more furniture to finish. He already has several orders but because of a lack of capital he can’t satisfy the demand for his products.

Narciso separated from his wife 8 years ago. He has one son who lives with his grandmother. Narciso is 43 years old and lives alone in his house. His hope is that he might be able to make his home suitable enough for his son to come and live with him, especially so that he can also start to learn, little by little, his trade.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Narciso tiene una experiencia de 25 años en su actividad. Comenzó trabajando para otra persona la que le enseño el oficio. Luego de esto poco a poco con sus ahorros decide abrir su propio negocio y comienza a tener sus clientes. Su trabajo consiste en comprar muebles y el les da el acabado dejándolos muy bonitos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en su domicilio. También lo contratan para realizar trabajos fuera de el. Su horario es de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Narciso desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de muebles y darle su acabado. Ya que tiene bastantes pedidos y por falta de capital no puede satisfacer la demanda que tiene.

Narciso esta separado de su esposa hace 8 años. Tiene un solo hijo el cual se encuentra viviendo con su abuela. Tiene 43 años y vive solo en su domicilio. Su deseo es poder tener ya adecuado su hogar para tener a su hijo con el. Además de que el comience a aprender poco a poco su oficio.

loans.use: Buy unfinished furniture

loans.name: Elisabete

texts.pt:
Elisabete P. is married with 2 children. She was born in Machangulo-Matutuine and is 35 years old. Due to a lack of financial resources she only attended school until the 3rd grade at the Education Center of Chiango. In her spare time she would help her mother cut wood and collect almonds for sale. The money she made helped her support her family. In 1990 she met her husband in Costa do Sol where they lived and had two daughters. In 1997 she moved to Matutuine and started a commercial business with her husband purchasing products in bulk and selling it at retail to the local community. Due to the lack of a Secondary School in Filipe for her children, they decided to move to Catembe, in the village of Chali, where they built a house and a commercial establishment with local products.

She and her husband manage the business personally and in their absence their children assume the responsibility. To supply the best, high-quality products to their customers, they decided to ask Hluvuku for a loan. With the loan of 400 dollars, they intend to increase the volume of their business by acquiring more products and guaranteeing a sufficient stock to meet customer demands. The business has a positive impact on the local community by providing groceries close to the community and at affordable prices. With the income from the business they are able to suport their childrens' studies and sustain the family. In the future, they hope to build a house and shop and own a vehicle for the transport of their products.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisabete P. casada maritalmente tem 2 filhas, nasceu em Machangulo-Matutuíne, tem actualmente 35 anos de idade, devido a falta de recursos financeiros estudou até a 3ª classe em 1986 no Centro Educacional de Chiango, e nos tempos livres ajudava a mae no corte de lenha, coleta de amenjoas para vender e ter algum dinheiro para sustento da familia.Em 1990 conheceu o marido na Costa do Sol onde viveram e teve duas filhas e no ano de 1997 veio viver em Matutuine e iniciam a actividade de comercio juntamente com o marido comprando produtos a grosso e retalho revendendo a comunidade local. Devido a falta duma Escola Secundária em Filipe para as crianças continuarem a estudar, decidem passar a viver em Catembe, concretamente no bairro Chali onde construiram uma casa e estabelecimento comercial com material local, dando assim continuidade a actividade comercial.

Ela e o marido gerem pessolamente o negócio e na ausência destes, as filhas ficam como responsáveis. Para satisfazer a maior procura dos produtos da primeira necessidade pelos clientes decidem pedir credito a Hluvuku. Com o crédito de 10.000 MT pretendem aumentar o volume do seus negocio adquirindo mais produtos e garantir um stock suficiente para rersponder as necessidades da sua clientela. A sua actividade tem impacto positivo póis além de abastecer a comunidade local em produtos da primeira necessidade, coloca os mesmos mais perto da comunidade e a preços bastantes acessiveis. Com o rendimento do empreendimento consegue por as crianças a estudar, sustentar familiar. No futuro almeja construir casa e uma mercearia em material convencional e se possivel ter um carro para transporte de produtos.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a taxi driver from the Ivano-Frankivsk region in western Ukraine. He has been working as a driver for about four years and prior to that he had been a security guard. Yuryi is divorced and has one son who is seven years old.

A goal oriented, hard working business owner, Yuryi has some definitive plans for the future. He currently has a new car to use as his taxi but he would like to make some modifications to it so that it can run on cheaper fuel. He has requested a loan of $600 from Nadiya Ukraine to purchase the necessary parts to make the conversion. In the future, Yuryi also hopes to purchase a second car and hire another driver to work for him. We are glad for opportunities like this to assist hard working entrepreneurs such as Yuryi with their businesses.

loans.use: Modify car to run on cheaper fuel

loans.name: Naintara

texts.en:
Mrs. Naintara S. is a 44-year-old resident of Dholko and lives with her husband and son. Her husband, Mr. Ganu S., works in a private office, and her son is studying in BBS level.
Mrs. S. opened a grocery shop a few years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. But due to lack of fund she can't expand her business. So in order to expand their business, she needs a Rs10,000 (US$175) loan. With this amount she will buy noodles, biscuits, rice, etc. for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Ahammd Fawood

texts.en: Ahammd Fawood lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has one son and lives with his own family. He is a doctor. He completed his education in India. When he came back two years ago, he opened a drug store in Kabul. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good income to help his family. He is happy now.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Namataba C Group

texts.en: Margret M. is married and has two children. She runs a stall in the local market where she sells food. Margret also leads a group of five women who have applied for a loan to expand this food-selling business. Margret plans to use the extra income to build a home for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Esteria K. is 27 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 5,7 and 10. She has two other dependents, who are her brothers in-law. In 1997, Esteria established a crops business. Esteria now requests a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Muharam

texts.en:
Muharam O. is 25 years old. She is married with two small kids.

Muharam is a market vendor. She has been selling fabrics to make traditional national dresses for more than 6 years. She is applying for a loan for the first time and hopes to expand her business with the help of the additional funding. At the same time, she wants to improve the condition of her place of business. By generating additional income, Muharam plans to improve her family's living conditions.

Muharam requests 2,000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months. Borrowing for the first time, she thanks all for trusting and supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods and improving the condition of her place of business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng K. (picture with his wife) married in 1987.  He has four children; two sons and two daughters. Both of his daughters work in a garment factory.  One of his sons is a mason and the younger one is in school. The family lives about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Heng has three years of experience constructing wooden houses. He learned this skill from his brother-in-law. His wife sells fruit in the village. She purchases the fruit from the market in Phnom Penh and resells it.

Mr. Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair his house and purchase fruit for his wife to resell.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell and repair his house

loans.name: Maria Cleofe's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Juanita, and Rosa have been members of the "Alegria Huamanga" community bank for 1-2 years. In that time, they have learned to be punctual and responsible. In addition, they have found support and learned to value themselves.

Maria is forty-four years old and has six children. Maria has owned a small grocery store for the past three years. Before that, she had a printing shop in the center of town, but the competition was too great and she decided to switch businesses.

Juanita is thirty-eight years old. She lives with her partner and their two children. Juanita has a small store and travels around the region buying and selling different products, depending on the season. She uses loans to smooth out slow spots between seasons.

Rosa is thirty years old. She is married and does not have any children. Rosa has been selling replacement car parts for one and a half years.

Maria, Juanita, and Rosa need loans of 2000, 600, and 600 soles (2.8 soles to $1). They will use these loans to buy increasingly large quantities of merchandise.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Maria, Juanita, and Rosa plan to use their savings to support children that are studying at the local university, visit a daughter who is living in Ayacucho, and to take a vacation in Lima.

They dream that their children will grow up strong and healthy, be able to attend the university, and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy increasingly large quantities of merchandise.

loans.name: Faamanu

texts.en: Faamanu is on her fourth loan now. This goes to show that she is a determined woman who is working hard to try and earn more money to take care of her family. She will use her loan partly for home repairs (by purchasing nails, iron and cement) and partly to improve her business by purchasing barbed wire and seeds for tomatoes, cabbages and pumpkins.

loans.use: To buy seeds and make home repairs

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es:
Ms. Alba T. is a married, 35-year-old mother of three (ages 4, 6, & 10) who lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. Her husband works as an agriculturist and contributes to the household expenses.

Ms. T. sells assorted products by credit. She has eight years of experience in the business. She started the business with loans, and it was been growing ever since. She wants to invest this new loan in the purchase of more products to offer her customers because she wishes to increase her merchandise variety and attract even more customers.

She plans to keep investing into her business, provide an education for her children, and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Alba tiene 35 años de edad, habita en el barrio Waspan Norte, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 4, 6 y 10 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como Ing. Agrónomo y aporta a los gastos del hogar.

Doña Alba vende mercadería variada al crédito, y lleva ocho años de experiencia, ella inició con préstamos y ha ido creciendo. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para invertir en capital, en la compra de más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, variedad de mercadería y la captación de clientes.

Sus planes son seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, educar a sus hijos y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise to offer to her customers

loans.name: Mrs. Cuc's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Cuc (ID: 09050052), aged 54, has finished paying back the loan she requested in the previous round. She raises pigs and sells necessities in the market for a living, which generates a fairly stable amount of income for her family. Mrs. Cuc is very interested in the loan method and repayment term of SEDA. She has been using the loans from SEDA very effectively. In the next round of loan, Mrs. Cuc would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to renovate the breeding facilities and purchase more food for the pigs. Other members in her group include:

-Mrs. Ngo Thi Bon (ID: 09050062) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to purchase food for her chickens.

-Mrs. N. Thi Lan (ID: 09050061) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to purchase food for her pigs.

-Mrs. Ngo Thi Luyen (ID: 09050060) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to raise chickens and go to the market.

-Mrs. N. Thi Thu (ID: 09050064) would like to borrow a loan of 2.242.000 VND to breed pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn thị Cúc MS 09050052, năm nay 54 tuổi Cô đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Hằng ngày Cô đi chợ và chăn nuôi lợn nên mức thu nhập của gia đình Cô cũng khá ổn định.Cô rất thích hình thức vay vốn này, vì nó đã giúp Cô có được những khoản tiền mà Cô đi chợ và chăn nuôi tiết kiệm được để sử dụng vào những mục đích lớn trong gia đình. Lần này Cô đăng ký vay ở mức 3.808.000 VND để sửa chuồng lợn và mua cám lợn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của Cô :

  • Chị Ngô thị Bốn MS 09050062 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để mua cám gà
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Lân MS 09050061 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Chị Ngô thị Luyện 09050060 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Thu MS 09050064 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để mua lợn giống

loans.use: vay vốn chăn nuôi

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is a widow of A. S. and lives in a small city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. Jamila baji completed her education until the 8th standard. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son drives a tractor, but he also has his own tea stall. The next eldest son also drives a tractor. Her eldest daughter knits warm clothes. Her younger daughter is in the 9th standard. Jamila baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her previous four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy supplies (kettle, cups, tea, and milk, sugar) to expand her son's tea business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy supplies and equipment for tea stall, supplies for grocery store, sewing machine, and clothes to resell

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara G. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. She is the executive of her business, and she is a reliable client who has not any problems repaying her prior loans.

Gulsara lives in the Nau region of Tajikistan. She is married, and she has 5 children. She is engaged in the business of trading towels, headscarves for women, and shoes. She purchases the goods herself so she has the opportunity to trade such goods for higher prices in order to generate profits for her business. Notably, she has many repeat customers and customers who buy goods in bulk.

Now, Gulsara is seeking, via Kiva, a business development loan in the amount of 4,000 STJ ($1,175) to be repaid in 4 months to import new seasonal goods and to thereby diversify her product offerings.

loans.use: To diversify her product line by importing additional seasonal goods

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 45 años, vive solamente con su pequeño hijo, ya que es divorciada. Se dedica a la venta de helados, desde que se separó de su esposo, tuvo que hacerse cargo de su pequeño sola y brindarle, educación, vestido y salud. Lucia acostumbra elaborar los helados durante la noche, para venderlos por las mañanas y las tardes. Sus dificultades en este caso, son tener que lidiar con el clima que por estos rumbos es muy frió, en esta temporada lluviosa, haciendo que la venta disminuya, por otro lado, el carisma de Lucía hace que tenga clientes muy asiduos, que degustan de sus ricos helados, esto conlleva a que no pierda los ánimos. Lucia se esmera en sacar adelante a su hijo y brindarle un futuro mejor. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar una nueva cajita donde vender los helados, ya que la que tiene ahora ya está un poco desgastada, además de incrementar su producción. En el futuro Lucia quiere tener un negocio más estable, como una tiendita de abarrotes o una ferretería.
texts.en:
Lucia is 45 years old and lives only with her son, as she is divorced. Since she split up with her husband she has been selling ice cream as she had to take charge of her young son alone and give him an education, clothing and keep him healthy. Lucia is used to making ice creams at night so she can sell them during the mornings and afternoons. The difficulty in doing this is the climate as in that area it is very cold and it is the rainy season, which means that her sales decrease. However, on the other hand Lucia has some faithful clients who really love her delicious ice creams, and this keeps her spirits up. Lucia goes to great lengths so allow her son to move forward and to give him a better future. With the money she's asked for she would like to buy a new ice box to sell ice creams from, as the one she has now is very worn, and this will increase her production. In the future Lucia wants to have a more stable business, like a grocery store or a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new box from which to sell her ice creams, as well as increasing her production

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
La señora Sandra S. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León donde se desempeña en su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido en su propia casa de habitación donde le visitan sus clientes.

Ella es madre de dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos se encuentra en edad escolar y por este motive ella debe suplir estos gastos y es importante decir que ella es el único sustento de su hogar y por esto se esfuerza cabalmente para lograr mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus dos pequeños hijos. La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos de pulpería para ofrecerlos y así continuar manteniendo su hogar y llevando el pan a su mesa.
texts.en:
Sandra Solis is from the municipality of Nagarote, in the city of Leon, where she runs a small grocery store out of her home. She has two young children, One of them is already in school, which generates additional expenses. Sandra is her home's only breadwinner, so she works very hard to improve the quality of life for her and her children. Sandra has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel looking for a loan that will allow her to restock her store with new products that she can offer to her customers, and continue to make her business grow to better support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to restock small store

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi Z. sells fried fish. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen at the shore, and brings them to her house for frying. She then sends them to the market for sale at Atonkwa near Elmina. Esi has received a junior high education. She is married and has 6 dependants.

Esi has been selling fried fish since 1993. She actually spends all of her income on the business, since her husband takes care of all the family's financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities and oil for frying the fish, and then for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family, and also support her husband to get their children a high level of education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities and oil for frying the fish and then for sale.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Thị P., năm nay 54 tuổi ở Kim Động. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi gà, vịt và trồng trọt. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2004. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi 150 con vịt đẻ, 100 con gà thịtvới thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 để mua thêm 500 con gà giống, mở rộng quy mô chăn nuôi của gia đình.
texts.en:
This year Mrs. Do Thi P. turns 54 years old. She lives in Kim Dong, Vietnam. The main source of income for her family is from raising chickens, ducks and farming. Mrs. P. has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2004. Currently her family has 150 ducks and 100 chickens, which brings about 2,000,000 VND per month (equivalent to 117 USD per month). She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND (or 875 USD) to buy 500 breeding cocks, expanding the scope of her farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Ciobanu Eudochia

texts.en:
Eudochia C. is 45 years old. Her business has been around for about 10 years. Selling vegetables has been a difficult business as there have been bad weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season with a rich harvest.

Eudochia is asking for a loan to invest in her fruit business, increasing her stock of vegetables to sell. This is an opportunity to increase her sales at the market in her village. MicroInvest gave her hope that the loan will develop her business.

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Rosa Leny

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. 
Rosa es casada tiene 47 años, dos hijos de 20 y 24 años que trabajan  y estudian. 
Rosa estudio secretariado pero no ejerció por que se caso.  Tenía un negocio de venta de fruta durante siete años, pero en la venta de fruta  hay pérdida por que la fruta se malogra rápido, decide cambiar de negocio hace ocho años, actualmente  se dedica a la   venta de  ropa de casa en casa, también ofrece  a sus amigas y vecinas.  
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  comprar ropa en gamarra, y venderla.
Desde que está en Finca trabaja con un capital seguro, con confianza, en las reuniones del Bancomunal aprende de las demás socias, y le gusta la confraternidad que hay entre las socias.
El sueño que Rosa tiene es tener su propio negocio en su casa, quiere poner un bazar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Let's Advance Together" Community Bank. She is 47 years old and has two children, ages 20 and 24 whom are working and studying. Rosa studied to be a secretary but never entered this line of work because she got married. For 7 years she owned a fruit business, but due to losses from spoiled produce she decided to shift lines of work 8 years ago. Currently, Rosa sells clothing door-to-door and to her friends and neighbors. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to purchase clothing in bulk and sell it. Since she has been involved with FINCA, she has had access to loans and confidence in her business. In the Community Bank meetings she enjoys learning from the other members, and enjoys the camaraderie. Rosa's goal is to open a business in her house, possibly a corner store.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk to sell

loans.name: Mwalami

texts.en: Mwalami Sadiki Mtumbuka is a micro-business man from Tanzania.  He runs a business of purchasing and selling chickens for broiling.  He purchases directly from small producers in wholesale and supplies to retail customers by order.  He temporarily keeps poultry in cages waiting for retail customers. He has been in the business for three years and is in need of 600,000 TZS to boost the business.

loans.use: To boost a poultry business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie M. is a 32-year-old woman from Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is married with 2 kids. Her husband works abroad.  Having started her sari-sari (variety) store business from a meagre capital, she coped well with the challenges of her business.  The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand. 

She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 to additionally capitalize her business.  She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future.  She envisions acquiring an additional market stall. She dreams also of renovating their little house and to start saving now for the education of their children

loans.use: Expansion for rice retailer of 5 sacks

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Mgeni has been a fish and bites seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.  


She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and other food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Mgeni is 45 years old, married, and has three children. They are 20, 15 and 9 years old. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zainab and Sauda. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more fish, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and other food items.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
"Before CEVI came, I was asking for a loan from lenders who charge high interest. I am happy now that I joined the CEVI program and have been their clients for a long time already. My husband and I till 1.5 hectare of land. We use our harvest to buy all the things we need in our family," says Mary Joy E., 34-year-old mother of four children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will truly help her improve her harvest.

CEVI provides borrowers with not just loan, but also gives training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Warun

texts.en:
Warun R. is currently in the business of selling cakes and is requesting a loan to purchase the ingredients to make cakes. Warun is thirty-two years old and married. Her husband is a security guard. She has two children, both of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, educatio, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. This microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make cakes for sale

loans.name: Ma. Luzviminda

texts.en:
Ma. Luzviminda D. grows rice for a living. It has been her dream to always be successful with her farm by consistently having a very good harvest. She is 41 years old and has four children. She worked previously as a saleslady. Her family is able to earn at least Php 20,000 every time they harvest their rice.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She believes that by doing so, she will help improve their harvest.

CEVI helps small entrepreneurs sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 37 años, está casada, tiene un hijo y actualmente vive con su familia en la casa que con mucha dedicación y empeño lograron conseguir junto a su esposo. Ella siempre pensó en tener un negocio y gracias a su pareja logróinstalar una farmacia que es de gran apoyo en su distrito. Desde hace 10 años viene atendiendo a sus clientes con suma responsabilidad, tratando de brindarles los mejores medicamentos para el restablecimiento de su salud. Sin embargo no siempre contó con los medicamentos necesarios, ya que en sus inicios sólo tenía las medicinas básicas, lo que limitaba sus ventas, pero con el tiempo aprovechó la demanda y adquirió exhibidores y vitrinas, viéndose en la necesidad de alquilar un local amplio en la plaza de su distrito donde atiende hasta el día de hoy. Desde entonces, su negocio sigue ampliándose y Marlene espera pronto instalar otra farmacia, tiene la esperanza de que con el esfuerzo que realiza junto a su esposo lograrán alcanzar sus metas. Con parte de un banco comunal, la responsabilidad y orden que hay dentro de su grupo es lo que más le agrada, ya que puede confiar en cada una de sus compañeras. Este es su crédito número 13 con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 3000 soles que ahora solicita los usará en la compra de los medicamentos que requiere para instalar su nueva farmacia.
texts.en:
Marlene is 37 years old, married, has one child, and currently lives with her family in the house that she and her husband managed to buy with much hard work. She always thought about having a business and, thanks to her partner, she managed to install a pharmacy that provides services for her district. She has been attending to her customers very responsibly for more than 10 years, trying to provide the best medications to help restore health. Regardless, she didn’t always have all the necessary items in her inventory. At the onset of her business, she only carried basic medicines and this limited her sales. Over time, however, she took advantage of the demand and acquired display cases and windows and saw the need to rent a large enough space in her district. This is where she works to this day. Her business has been expanding, and Marlene hopes to open another drugstore soon. She hopes that, through her and her husband’s efforts, they will manage to reach their goals. The responsibility and order that exists within the group is what she most appreciates about being part of a cooperative bank, and she has confidence in each and every one of her colleagues. This is her 13th credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She will use the 3,000 soles she is now requesting to buy the medications she needs to open her new pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama I. est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de fruits et légumes à Adeta depuis 5 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des fruits et légumes auprès des agriculteurs et de venir les revendre au marché. Elle désire avec ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son commerce.
texts.en:
Mariama I., age 35, is married and the mother of 2 children. She's been reselling fruits and vegetables in Adeta for 5 years. Her business consists in buying fruits and vegetables from farmers, and to resell them at the market. She would like to use this loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
"Because of my loans from CEVI, I now have 4 pigs for fattening and 1 hectare rice field." says Virgie S., a farmer and mother of four children whose eldest child is now 18 years old and studying in high school. 

Virgie is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. which she joined in October 2007. She will use the loan to buy needed fertilizers and chemicals to grow her crops, and feed to grow her pigs. She chose CEVI because of its good services and low interest rate. "The policy is good and it is a Christian organization. I like the biblical reflection they have every meeting", she said.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Kuña Aty Asentamiento San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del Asentamiento San Antonio de la cuidad de Eusebio Ayala.
Con el apoyo crediticio y las capacitaciones  que la fundación Paraguaya les brinda, hoy por hoy, aunque sea se sienten seguras de lo que comercialmente realizan ya que estos implican riesgos económicos y una buena planificación previa. 
A esta fecha operan con la fundación paraguaya en el ciclo número 3 del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, emprendiendo cada día proyectos de mejoramiento y desarrollo para personas  de escasos recursos. 
Estas Señoras agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad y todos los beneficios que han recibido, y esperan seguir al tanto de las reglas para continuar trabajando con la Institución. 
Las actividades que realizan estas señoras y en las cuales invertirán sus créditos son:
Guillermina Q.	Kiosko 
María Auxiliadora López	Venta de ropa
Mirian Celeste B.	Venta de cosméticos
Fermina López	Despensa                                                                                                                                                                          
Tomasa O.	Venta de chipa
Isabel V.	Venta de chipa
Laura Raquel M.	Venta de mercerías
Jeny A.	Venta de mercerías
Basilia D.	Kiosko
Gloria C.	Cría de pollo
Fátima G. 	Venta de verduras
Damasia M.	Venta de verduras
Mirian Z.	Producción y venta de croche 
Jorgelina M.	Venta de bijuterie
Salvadora V.	Venta de chipa
Fidelina C. Venta de carbón
Lorena G. Venta de Sabanas
Laura A. Venta de Ropas 
Limpia C.	Venta de dulces

Venta de Ropas 
Venta de dulces

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias como ropas, comestibles, carbón, biuouterie, hilos, frutas, hortalizas, etc.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Soutoura sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 33, ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à OUAYERMA 1  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt de groupe. Tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
 Elles font entre autres comme activités, la vente de la pomme de terre,  du charbon de bois, de la  brochette de viande, du gingembre, de l’encens etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre, 20 sacs de charbon de bois, 15 kg de viande pour faire des brochettes, 5 sacs de gingembre et  30 kg de magnokisseni pour la fabrication de l’encens. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes de façon fixe dans les différents marchés de la ville de Sikasso et dans  les quartiers de façon ambulante, la plupart au comptant, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 32.500 FCFA qu’elles comptent utiliser comme épargne, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestie le reste dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres  agrandir leurs activités.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Soutoura group are all married, and are on average 33 years old with 3 children. They live in polygamous households in Ouayerma, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) in order to satisfy the demands of their clientele, and are seeking their fifth group loan. All four of their previous loans were repaid without difficulty. They run businesses that include, among others, the sale of potatoes, charcoal, brochettes of meat, ginger, incense, etc. With their new loan, they intend to buy ten 50-kg sacks of potatoes, 20 bags of charcoal, 15 kg of meat to make brochettes, 5 bags of ginger and 30 kg of "magnokisseni" to make incense. They supply themselves at the grand market in Sikasso city and in the neighbouring villages.
