They make their sales at stalls in various markets in the city of Sikasso and door-to-door in various areas, mostly in cash, to a clientele composed of men and women. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 32,500 FCFA each, which they intend to use for savings and to pay for their families' expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in their businesses. Some of the members of this group hope to buy land to live on in Sikasso, and others aim to enlarge their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Âgé de 35 ans, Monsieur Nouhoum Dembélé est marié et père de 4 enfants (2garçons et 2 filles). Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie chez son père à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Nouhoum est un forgeron de couche sociale, qui n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Très vite il s’initia à l’activité familiale à savoir la fabrication d’objets utilitaires à base d’aluminium. Il achète l’aluminium à Bamako pour les  transformer en objets de toutes sortes : Marmite, théière, assiette, cuillère, etc.
Nanti d’une grande expérience et d’une bonne réputation, il jouit d’importante sollicitation  des clients pour la qualité de ses services. 
Compte tenu de ses moyens  très limités, pour satisfaire la demande qui est de plus en plus forte de sa clientèle, il intègre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel pour acheter, 725 kg d’aluminium afin de  relancer son activité. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de faire face aux besoins de sa famille, ensuite investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat d‘Aluminium.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa P. is from the village of Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconut fruits for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chong

texts.en:
Chong R. is 50 years old and lives in the Battambang province with her husband and three of her adult children.

Since 2005 she has sold Khmer food at the local market to earn approximately US$9 eveR. day. Her husband is too old to make a living so he stays at home. Chong is aided by her three children, of whom two are construction workers and one is a mechanic repairer.

Chong R. is asking for a loan of US$1000 so her son can open a mechanic shop and purchase mechanic’s tools for his business.

loans.use: Open a mechanic shop.

loans.name: Particia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 50-year-old married woman with two children aged 15 and 23 years. Both of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with four people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Patricia has a retail shop selling all household essentials. She works seven days a week in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She serves an average of ten customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She incurs transport costs to and from shopping from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. Her major business challenges are thieves and the ever-increasing prices of essentials in Uganda.

Patricia has been in her business for over five years and with MCDT also for five years. She is servicing her tenth loan. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with it. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop. She aspires to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia T. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes. She is 46 years old. Leticia is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leticia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Leticia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth G. is the one wearing the white T-shirt and in front is her husband. Lilibeth is from the village of South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 28 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the market. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilibeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additonal fish to sell

location.town: Souht Westen Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.en:
Maria Rosario B. is from the village of Sta. Barbara. She is 27 years old. Maria Rosario is single and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Rosario owns & operates a service-based business providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. Maria Rosario has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Maria Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed for her business. Maria Rosario is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more materials needed to provide services such as nailpolish, cotton, and acetone. This will be the third loan taken out by Maria Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Nathan Douglas

texts.en: N. Nathan Douglas is a businessman who is 36 years old. He is married with five children. He owns a poultry farm and he has been carrying out this business for over five years. He is using the loan to purchase poultry drugs, poultry feeds and different breeds of chicks, such as layers and broilers. His future plan is to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase poultry drugs, poultry feeds and chicks

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 47 years old, married to Priscah O., and they have three school-going children. He has been selling spray paint for motor vehicles in Naivasha town since 2004.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to buy more paint to sell to re-stock his business.

His future plans are not just to supply the paint retail but also wholesale.

loans.use: Buy more paints for sell

loans.name: Allah Malayah Group

texts.en: Allah Malayah is a group of five borrowers led by Saah J.. He is 36 years old, single and has no children. Saah could not continue his education past 8th grade due poverty. For seven years, Saah has been selling belts on Randall Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He buys a wide variety of belts, which is appealing to his customers. He would eventually like to move his business into a shop. Saah will use this loan to purchase more belts. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Saah is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more belts

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna M. was born in 1957 and lives with her family in Bargushat village, Kapan area. She has six children: four daughters and two sons; five of them are already married and live separately from their parents.

Ruzanna works in her village as a club manager and at the same time she, her husband and her elder son, who lives with them, engage in farming. They are mainly busy in dairy produce and meat production.

Ruzanna asks for a 700,000 AMD loan to buy some sheep for her farm, which will help her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy some sheep for her farm

loans.name: Malicse's Group

texts.en:
Maria M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Maria is the group leader of a five member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general retail store) business which sells a variety of different products in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Maria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ametossina

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est lancé dans un commerce d'un genre particulier qui est le commerce en détail de gravier qu'elle stocke dans des bassines, elle s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé par convoyage de camions. elle a reçu des commandes de ses clients, pour les satisfaire, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour le convoyage de 4 camions de graviers. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
Ametossina A. started a very special business, namely retailing gravel. She stores the gravel in large basins. She gets her supplies at the Autonomous Port of Lomé and conveys them by truck. She secured a few orders from customers; to carry them out, she came to WAGES and applied for a loan to convey four trucks of gravel. Ametossina is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gravel

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha ,D. 43 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Vive en la localidad D. Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donD. tiene su casa que es propia.Antes D. iniciarse  en la actividad agrícola, sus padres eran agricultores y  ella aportaba y a cambio percibía sus primeros sueldos. Se sentía emocionada y  con ganas D. trabajar , tanto le gustó y sin pensarlo siguió el mismo camino. Pero, después D. un tiempo ,cultivó un producto que le generó bastante ganancia en corto tiempo. Es por esta razón  que se dedicó al cultivo D. la hoja D. coca. Su estrategia D. éxito es que labora en su chacra desD. las 5:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm , y sus productos los lleva a su localidad, para venderlos  en los grandes centros D. acopio. Normalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda D. sus hijos, y juntos hacen buen equipo. En un tiempo cercano piensa diversificar sus productos, cultivando cacao y café.Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus  pagos, además tiene mucha fe D. que  llegará lejos con su grupo comunal , por la responsabilidad que tiene cada uno D. los integrantes.Bertha  invertirá una parte del dinero solicitado en lo gastos escolares D. sus hijos y el resto lo  destinará para comprar abono , con el propósito D. mejorar la producción D. sus plantaciones D. hoja D. coca.
texts.en:
Bertha is 43 years old, married with 8 children. She lives in her own home in Santa Rosa which is located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle. Like her parents before her, she is involved in agriculture which is how she received her first wages. She was happy to work and enjoyed what she was doing. Without giving it a second thought, she followed in her parent’s path. After a while, she started to grow a product that generated significant income in a short time. For this reason, she dedicated herself to growing coca leaves. Her strategy is to work in her fields from 5:00am until 6:00pm. She sells her produce locally to middlemen. Normally she works alone, but occasionally she receives help from her children and together they make a great team. In the near future, she is thinking of diversifying her crops and cultivating both cocoa and coffee. This is her third credit with MFP and she promises to complete her repayment plan punctually. She has great faith that she will go far with her communal group as each member is very responsible. Bertha will use part of her loan to pay for her children’s school expenses. The rest will be used to buy fertilizer in the hopes of improving her production of coca leaves.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.name: Ervin Jose

texts.es:
Ervin Jose de 41 años es casado con la Sra. Antonia Flores con quien tiene 3 hijos: Ervin de 19 años que trabaja y les apoya con los gastos de la casa, Elmer de 17 años estudiando el 2do año de secundaria y Rachel de 10 añitos en 5to grado de primaria. 

Don Ervin trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 17 años como conductor, esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, haciendo la division  de concreto de los cuartos de su casa, pues actualmente no cuentan con ella, el pretende que tanto el como sus hijos cuenten con privacidad ya que estan creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es que sus hijos se preparen y en el futuro sean hombres de bien y que puen servirle a nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Ervin Jose, 41, is married to Antonia Flores, and they have three children: Ervin, 19, who works and helps with household costs; Elmer, 17, who is in his second year of high school; and little Rachel, 10, who is in 5th grade. Ervin as worked for the town of Juigalpa for 17 years as a driver. He is requesting his first loan with the goal of improving his house, by making concrete divisions in the rooms; they do not currently have any, and he and his family need privacy as the children are growing and need their own space. His greatest dream is for his sons to grow and be good men who can serve their country.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build walls

loans.name: Elvis Arturo

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito dedicado principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja desde hace un año preparando y vendiendo leche de soya, el prepara este producto todos los dias y lo vende muy temprano en su mismo distrito, sus clientes la adquieren para consumirla en el desayuno. Con las ganancias que percibe de este negocio el solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia con los gastos diarios.

Elvis gusta mucho de cocinar y prepara con buena sazón sus comidas, el desea valerse de esta habilidad para adquirir más ingresos y tener un negocio propio de venta de comida, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir algunos utensilios para empezar a preparar menús y venderlos entre los vecinos de su distrito.

Elvis es un joven honesto y empendedor, sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y que no gusta de hacer problemas. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Eighteen year-old Elvis is single and lives with his parents in the Nueva Arica district, principally an agricultural district with activities like breeding and tobacco cultivation. It is located one and a half hours away from Chiclayo city. For one year Elvis has produced and sold soy milk. He makes this product every day and sells it very early where he lives. His customers buy it to drink for breakfast. With his earnings, he settles his personal expenses and helps his family with the daily expenses. Elvis really likes to cook and makes flavorful food. He wants to make use of this ability to increase his income and have his own food sales business. To realize his goal, he believes it is a good idea to get a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will allow him to get utensils to begin preparing food and selling it to his neighbors. Elvis is an honest and entrepreneurial young man. His neighbors consider him a calm person who does not like causing problems. His biggest desire is to have his own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils to make and sell food

loans.name: Abdullayeva

texts.en: Abdullayeva A. is a 47 year old woman who breeds cattle.  She has been in this business since 2003. She is married and has three children. She breeds cattle for meat products and cows for milk and milk products. Her monthly income is 150-200 AZN which is not enough to cover family needs. A. is requesting a loan for 1000 AZN to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 3 Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her group, "Mujeres Poderosa 3" ("Powerful Women 3"). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenges were raising her children all by myself. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to sing and helping others.

Luz plans to use this loan to invest in her fruit stand, by buying coconuts, plantains, banana, cane, and other fruits. She will use the profits to invest in her business and she dreams of improving it and being able to help others. She has had her business for one year, starting with $27 US that she saved.  Luz is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. 

Luz's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism.  This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy coconut, plantains, cane and all kind of fruits for her fruit stand

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is 33 years old and married.  He is blessed with two children: Josephine, 9, and Stephen, 6 years old.  He sells milk to earn a living.  

He appreciates Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to keep business records.  Currently, he is able to run his business well and has employed one person.  He has nine years of experience in the business.  He is also employed in a restaurant.  He was previously operating a retail shop.  

He wants to take out his first loan of 20,000 KES to increase his stock and to purchase a bicycle for delivering milk.  He hopes to buy a car for transporting milk in the future.  In ten years, he wants to expand his shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To increase his stock and purchase a bicycle for delivering milk

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar lives in a three-roomed house in a city called Vehari which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She is 39 years old, married to M. A. and has one daughter. She owns & operates a clothes sewing business. She sews clothes based on orders she receives from her neighborhood and from various boutiques.
 
Her husband is attached to a milk selling business. He sells milk in different areas of the city. He leaves home at 7am, taking milk on his motorbike in big jars to supply to different homes and shops. He has been doing this work for over five years. He has a buffalo which produces 8-12 kg milk for him which earns him almost 360-540 PKRs per day.
  
Kousar has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to enhance his business by purchasing another dairy cow. In this way he will be able to increase his milk production, which he can then supply to a good number of clients.
 
Kousar hopes that the loan will enable her husband to make a positive change in his business and increase his income. Kousar is a new loan user and she hopes it will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Ida Marie Claire

texts.fr: cette femme exerce depuis 2003 le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle fait face en ce moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock avec 10 sacs de riz, 15 bidons d'huile et 1 cartons de sucre. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Since 2003 this woman has been a retail merchant of general food products. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé and has a wide customer base. At present she is facing a stock shortage and is requesting a loan that will enable her to increase her stock with 10 bags of rice, 15 containers of vegetable oil and one carton of sugar. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general food products

loans.name: 060209-Tien Phong-Hoang Chau Group

texts.en:
Lien T. T. (55) is a 38 year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 060209-Tien Phong-Hoang Chau (060209-Tien Phong-Hoang Chau).

Lien is widowed and has one adult child. To making a living, Lien operates a family member's business venture selling flowers. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 1000000 VND a month.

In 2009, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women used to invest in expanding the business and is now requesting a new loan of 5000000 VND to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the second taken out by Lien from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Ly L. T. (49) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  Thao L. T. (54) is a 37 year-old woman who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  Oi L. T. (7) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  Xuan D. T. (56) is a 27 year-old woman who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Lien T. T. (55) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 060209-Tien Phong-Hoang Chau (060209-Tien Phong-Hoang Chau).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hoa trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND.  Vào 2009, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Ly L. T. (49) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Thao L. T. (54) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Oi L. T. (7) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  Xuan D. T. (56) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz C. is the leader of this group.  She is 31 and married. She has three daughters; all of them are at school.  Jyldyz is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband takes orders to make iron gates.  Reselling cattle after fattening, Jyldyz makes 5000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more cattle to raise. In the future she plans to open a sewing workshop. 

Jyparkul K. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 31 and married. She has a daughter and a son. Her husband is a taxi-driver and she works in the Social Affairs Department.  Jyparkul and her husband also breed cattle to earn money. With money received from the loan, Jyparkul wants to purchase cattle to raise and hay to feed them during the winter season. 

Mirlan I. is 28. He works in the Police Department. Because of the low salary, two years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, he started to raise cattle. He resells the cattle after fattening. In this way he makes 2000 soms per month. He hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to purchase cattle to raise.

Jyparkul U., 43, is married. She has three sons; all of them are at school. Jyparkul works as a baker and her husband is a mechanic.  Two years ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Jyparkul and her husband started to raise cattle. With money received from the loan, they want to purchase hay for their cattle. In the future they plan to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Patricia P. es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Republicano, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, con 4 hijos todos mayores de edad.
 
       Se dedica en la producción y venta de leche, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señora muy trabajadora, excelente cliente con nosotros y con otras entidades financieras.

             El cliente con este crédito va comprar 1 lechera para producir mejor y asi tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia P. is from the city of San Estanislao, of the Republicano neighborhood. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 grown children. 
 
She works in the production and sale of milk, with a steady clientele, a good income, and good business and personal references. She is a very hardworking woman who is an excellent client of ours and of other financial entities. 

With this loan, the client will buy 1 dairy cow for better prodution and thus better income.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Juevil

texts.en:
Juevil M. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Juevil is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Juevil owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motor services to local community members. Juevil has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juevil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juevil is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Juevil from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide sufficient services

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene la edad de 31 años. Su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos pues ha sido muy beneficios. Ella ofrece los productos como calzado, cosméticos, ropa y otras cosas en general.  Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además buscar el alimento diario. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en: Maria Elena is 31 years old, she sells general merchandize. This is not her first loan; the previous ones have been very helpful for her. She sells products like shoes, makeup, clothing and other general items. She has to pay her household bills as well as daily food. The reason for the loan is to buy raw materials and basic household goods. Maria Elena’s biggest dream is to keep living to keep working on her business.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza is married and has two children. She is a small market entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Mahfuza sells children clothing in one of the local markets. Mahfuza rents a small facility that serves as a vending outlet. She admits that she started this business because it was the only way to survive when her family was going through some challenging financial times. Mahfuza has been in this business for six years. She has a long-term view for her business development and is disciplined with all her business plans. All this promotes successful growth of her business. Moreover, Mahfuza is not afraid of serious amounts of hard work which reveals her great entrepreneurial potential and secures prompt loan repayment. Mahfuza is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to increase the selection of clothing items that she offers for sale in her store.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase of new goods.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina A. is a 51 year-old-woman, who lives on Shikhlinski Street of the Imishli region. She is married and a mother to one daughter. Madina sells meat and dairy from her cattle-breeding business, which she started in 2006. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Madina is grateful to Aqroinvest and Kiva for the opportunity given to her in the form of this first loan. She used this loan of 800 AZN to purchase three cows. Madina's goal is to increase the number of cattle she breeds regularly to ten heads.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Kim Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Orn Y. is living in Krang Chamraeun village in Takeo province. She was born in 1976. Nowadays, she and her husband, Mr. Huy Kuon, are farmers. They own a small piece of land where they can grow rice to sell to support their family. She is also a weaver. Since her business is going well from time to time, she wants to expand. So, for this purpose, Mrs. Kim Orn Y. is seeking a loan to buy more silk. She is the mother of two children who are attending public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Eugene

texts.fr: Eugene M. est aide mécanicien et travailleur de construction et aide mécanicien, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 43 ans, il est né a Rwanda, et il est célibataire.  Il a une éducation d’école primaire, et il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des tôles, sables, portes, et chaux pour la construction des maisons.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de continuer à construire les parcelles pou qu’il puisse d’avoir les maisons à louer.  Apres avoir construire une maison pour lui-même, il va marier.
texts.en: Eugene M. is a mechanic's aide, a construction worker, and he has been a member of ACB (Kiva Field Partner) since 2007. He is 43 years old, he was born in Rwanda, and he is single. He has a primary school education, and he will use his loan to purchase tiles, sand, doors, and lime to build houses. He is business plans are to build in order to have houses to rent. After he is able to build a house for himself, he plans to get married.

loans.use: To purchase tiles, sand, doors, and lime.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 26 Décembre 1963 à N’Kourala préfecture de Sikasso, Mariam Koné est veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles. Elle réside avec ses  propres enfants et des enfants adoptifs au quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mariam K. après avoir avoir perdu son époux il y’a dix sept ans, s’est initiée au  commerce  d’articles divers tels l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires. Elle vend au nouveau de marché dont elle dispose d’un magasin et table où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Ainsi elle a bénéficié  de deux prêts qui ont été tous remboursés avec succès. Alors dans but de toujours mieux se relancer dans même activité, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour pouvoir acheter, 15 sacs de pomme de terre, 12 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes et un important stock de condiments alimentaires (gombo, sel de cuisine, concentrée de tomates, etc).
Ces marchandises  qu’elle achète sur place avec les paysans producteurs venant des villages environnants sont ramenées dans les marchés hebdomadaires de Yorosso et Kouri, vers la frontière Mali-Burkina Faso pour être vendues en détail  et en gros au comptant les jours de foire à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on December 26, 1963 in N’Kourala, in Sikasso prefecture, Ms. Mariam Koné is a widow and the mother of two boys and two girls.  She resides with her own children and adopted children in the Médine district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having lost her husband seventeen years ago, she got started in commerce, the buying and selling of a variety of items such as condiments. She sells at the new market where she has a store and a table. There, she is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her goods. 

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Mariam decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. Thus, she has benefited from two loans, which have both been repaid successfully. And so, with the goal of reinvigorating the same business further, she is requesting this third loan, which will enable her to increase her working capital in order to buy:  15 sacks of potatoes, 12 sacks of onions, various grains, and a major stock of condiments (okra, kitchen salt, tomato paste, etc.) These goods, which she buys locally from peasant producers from surrounding villages, are taken to the weekly markets of Yorosso and Kouri, toward the Mali-Burkina Faso border, in order to be sold retail and wholesale to a customer base composed essentially of fair-goers paying cash on the days the fairs take place.  

With this loan, Mariam envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: Buying condiments, potatoes, Maggie bouillon cubes, onoions, etc.

loans.name: Billah

texts.en:
Billah is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, Billah  has operated a retail shop, selling goods in the local community. Her husband also contributes to the family’s income. Billah’s major business challenge is seasonality. 

Billah decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour. In the future, Billah hopes to open another retail shop and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Almabubu

texts.en:
Almabubu  A. is a 63 year old pensioner who lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is widowed and has eleven grown children; ten of them live on their own and the youngest son lives with her and helps in the household. In 1970, in order to support her family and cover all expenses, Almabubu decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. With a starting capital of 8,000 KGS, she managed to expand her farm. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastured her livestock in mountainous areas with native grasses. With the revenues, she was able to give good dowries to her daughters and provide them with all they needed.

Almabubu's farm now amounts to one cow and five sheep. She plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden her business and hold her son’s marriage. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 45 años de edad, reside en El Divisadero departamento de Morazán, vive con su madre y una hermana; Carlos se dedica a la venta de periódicos, los distribuye en una bicicleta, su trabajo inicia a las 4:00am cuando recibe los periódicos y desde ese momento recorre varios lugares, cantones y la ciudad.

El solicita un préstamo para la compra de periódicos, pues sus ventas a los clientes son al crédito y recibe los pagos a finales de cada mes, por lo que necesita el préstamo para comprar el periódico en efectivo.

Para Carlos la aspiración es lograr mantener el negocio de sus mismas ventas, logrando independizarse de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 45 years old, lives in El Divisadero, in the department of Morazán. He lives with his mother and a sister. Carlos sells newspapers; he distributes them on a bicycle. His work begins at 4:00 AM when he receives the newspapers, and from that moment he travels to various places, cantons and the city.

He requests a loan to buy newspapers, because his sales to customers are on credit and he receives payment at the end of each month, so he needs the loan to buy the newspaper in cash.

Carlos' goal is to maintain his business from his own sales, successfully gaining independence from financing.

loans.use: to buy newspapers

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Con su anterior credikiva, Sebastián adquirió un molino eléctrico y también le alcanzó para comprar mas materia prima e insumos, ahora sus tiempos de producción son mejores y trabaja más eficientemente. En la actualidad se propone comprar una betería de cocina, utensilios varios y también como hizo créditos a  nuevos clientes,  financiará su cartera; esto es justamente en lo que invertirá el financiamiento al que está aplicando mediante  la línea credikiva. Sebastián envía muchos agradecimientos a sus financiadores por ayudarlo: Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Sebastián H. puede acceder al siguiente enlace:
  

http://www.kiva.org/lend/175710
texts.en: With his previous Kiva loan, Sebastián acquired an electric mill and also managed to buy more raw materials and supplies.  Now his production times have improved and he works more efficiently.  He is currently planning to buy pots and pans, various utensils and also, as he offered credit to new customers, he will finance his portfolio.  This is what he plans to invest his Kiva loan in.  Sebastián sends lots of thanks to his financial backers for their help.  If you would like to know more about Sebastián's story, you can click on the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/175710

loans.use: to buy pots and pans, various utensils and also, because he offered credit to his customers, to finance his portfolio

loans.name: Rogoberto

texts.es: Rogoberto tiene 32 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Epifania de 34 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Rogoberto son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos, como el café, cacao y hojas de coca son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, además que los frutos que cosecha son de buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus plantaciones. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de sus cultivos, ya que son muy pesados y le quitan mucha energía.. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el quinto préstamo de Rogoberto con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con el crédito solicitado comprará animales de carga como el burro, ya que le será muy útil en los traslados de lo que cosechará.
texts.en:
Rogoberto, age 32, is a cheerful and hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his wife Epifania, age 34, and their 3 dear children, to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life.  The fields Rigoberto has cultivated with so much effort are the principal source of sustenance for his family.  Their products, like coffee, cacao, and coca leaf, are much sought after in the city of San Francisco.  In addition, the fruits that he harvests are of high quality.

What he likes most about his work is protecting his fields from the plague of insects that can affect his crops.  He has been involved in this business for 15 years.  He considers the most difficult part the transportation of sacks of his produce since they are very heavy and take a lot of energy to move.  In the future, he hopes to buy more land in order to increase his harvests.

This is Rogoberto’s fifth loan with MFP.  He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial for the development of his business.  He is a cheerful member of the communal bank and always brings order to the meetings.  With the loan applied for he will an buy animals for carrying cargo, like burros, since they will be very useful in transporting what he harvests.

loans.use: to purchase burros.

loans.name: Lkham

texts.en:
Mrs.Lkham N., a 58-year-old widow, lives in her children's neighborhood in a small ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Her children live with their spouses and children in separate houses on one plot of land. Since 1998 Lkham has run a furniture-making business first established by her husband. Assisted by some of her children, she sells her products at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in the city.

Having received and repaid a Kiva loan last year, Lkham is now requesting a new one to purchase wood materials to construct new types of furniture including children’s bunk beds and tables and chairs for café and bars, all currently in high demand.

loans.use: to buy more wooden materials to produce furniture.

loans.name: Mahulome Ekpe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULOME EKPE est formé de quatre personnes qui habitent le même quartier au Benin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Brigitte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Brigitte est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Saturnin. Le couple a trois enfants, vivant tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Il y a près de cinq ans que Brigitte mène comme activité la vente  de vêtements tous cousus et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Brigitte achète ses articles à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Brigitte désire obtenir un financement, ensemble avec ses autres membres.
texts.en: MAHULOME EKPE is a group composed of 4 people who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group representative, Brigitte, is the one raising her hand on the picture. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDé, in order to increase their business. Brigitte is married to a mechanic named Saturnin. The couple takes care of their 3 children, some of whom go to school. Brigitte and her husband have been living in their neighborhood with their children for just 2 years. They both provide for their family. Brigitte has been selling ready-to-wear clothes and shoes, door to door, for about 5 years. Brigitte buys those items in Dantokpa, an international market in Bénin. In order to strenghten her business and better meet the needs of her customers, Brigitte, along with the other members of the group, is seeking funding.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with 5 children. She is 46 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for 5 years.

Veronica sells items like canned goods to the people in her community. She usually earns about 4,000 PHP per month through her sari-sari store. Veronica also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Veronica is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items, such as noodles and spices, to sell. She also plans to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs. Veronica hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as noodles and spices

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette was born in 1987 and she has two children who are aged one and three years old. Violette owns a shop in which she sells different items such as candles, matches, sanitary pads and a few foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum, etc., and she has been doing this business for two years. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sorghum and beans. With the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Stephen faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Francisca has a retail shop that sells bananas, snacks and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy additional bananas and snacks. 

Francisca is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas and snacks

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
In the picture, Efua is showing three pans that contain plastic bowls, hair creams, ladies slippers and spoons in Abura. 

She is married and has three children. She has been in this retail business for six years. Her husband is a painter. Efua assists her spouse with paying utility bills and other household expenditures. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more of the above-mentioned items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wishes to build a shop for the products.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, hair creams, ladies slippers and spoons for resale.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is from the village of Ikalto, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. He is 26 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Teona, his 20-year-old brother and his parents. Shota works as a distributor in a local distribution company and has a salary of 400 Laris per month. 

Shota’s family runs a dairy farm. Shota is involved in the family business. They produce yogurt and cheese and sell it in Telavi. The average income of the family from the dairy farm is 900 Laris. 

Shota requested a loan to purchase feed for the cows. They will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now and the price increases by 30-40 % in the fall months. By purchasing the hay in July, Shota significantly saves on the cost of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they’ll give a planned amount of milk to the family.

loans.use: to purchase hay for his cows

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Eva has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Abakoranabushake / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Damascène est commerçant  et il est membre du groupe Abakoranabushake. Il est né au Rwanda et a 39 ans. Il est marié et il a 4 enfants de 6 à 13 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 7 ans de primaire. 
C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les fers (métaux) de la fabrication des différents objets pour les revendre dans sa région et dans les pays voisin.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de travailler beaucoup pour faire connaitre son business aux clients. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait être un grand commerçant, et distributeur des objets fabrique en métal. Avec les profits, Il voudrait  payer les frais des études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Damascène is a merchant and a member of the group Abakoranabushake. He was born in Rwanda and is 39 years old. He is married and has four children, from 6 to 13 years old. The four children are in school. He has a 7th grade education.

This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy metal for making different items to resell in his area and in neighboring countries. His strategy for business growth is to work a lot to publicize his business to his customers.  

In the next few years, Jean would like to be a major merchant and to distribute items manufactured from metal. With the profits, he would like to cover the cost of schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy metals for making various items to resell in his area and in neighboring countries

loans.name: Unurjav

texts.en:
Unurjav, 26, lives with her husband and younger brother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Mongolia's Hovd Province. Her husband and brother both have their private businesses, and Unurjav started her business in 2010 by selling dairy products at the Han-Ord local market. During the summertime, she works at a construction site with her husband.

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase dairy products at wholesale prices. A hard-working and diligent woman, Unurjav says, "My life is getting better each day .... Now everyone in my family is working. In the future, I want to have a good business and good income sources."

loans.use: To purchase dairy products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne, age 30, is a businesswoman. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last eight years, she has been doing some tailoring work. She also operates a boutique and she owns rental houses which earn her extra income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 95,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is married and has four children aged between one and fifteen. They are all in school apart from the youngest. 
Celestin has a butcher shop and a general store, which he has been running for ten years. These businesses have enabled him to care for his family and send his children to school. He butchers goats and in the store he sells sugar, salt, potatoes, etc. He needs a loan to buy more goats and more foodstuffs. With the profits he will pay school fees and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more goats and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es: Hedibia es la presidenta  de la Alcancía Comunal “Señor Nazareno” grupo conformando por 07 personas trabajadoras y entusiastas. Hedibia tiene 51 años de edad es casada y tiene 05 hijos de los cuales 02 de ellos dependientes aun, ya que están en etapa escolar, Hedibia es una mujer trabajadora que con los deseos de progresar  y de aportar con los gastos del hogar inicia su propio negocio la cual vende ambulatoriamente frutas, gaseosas y  confiterías donde la gran mayoría de sus clientes son personas que viajan al centro del país. Gracias a su esfuerzo  Hedibia ha logrado mejorar su vivienda. El anhelo de Hedibia es de instalar una tienda en su casa donde pueda vender sus productos y no tener que trabajar ambulatoriamente. Con el crédito que recibió de EDAPROSPO lo invertirá en su negocio comprando frutas (manzana, melocotón, uvas), gaseosas y confiterías (maní, habas) y de este modo tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Señor Nazareno” están muy agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa Prosperidad. Margarita no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Hedibia is the president of the “Señor Nazareno” Communal Bank, a group made up of seven hardworking and enthusiastic members. Hedibia is 51 years old and married. She has 5 children of whom 2 are still dependent since they are of school age.

Hedibia is a hardworking woman. With a desire to progress and contribute to the household expenses, she began her own business selling fruits, soft drinks, and snacks on an itinerant basis. Most of her customers are people that travel to the center of the country.

Thanks to her hard work, Hedibia has succeeded in improving her house. Her dream is to install a shop in her house where she can sell her products and not have to work itinerantly. She will invest the loan she receives from EDAPROSPO in her business, purchasing fruits (apples, peaches, grapes), soft drinks, and snacks (peanuts and beans), and in this way have what she needs for her customers.

The “Señor Nazareno” Communal Bank is very grateful and promises to continue working with Programa Prosperidad (Prosperity Program). Margarita wasn’t able to be present for the photo because of her work.

loans.use: to purchase fruits soft drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 39 años, es una mujer felizmente casada hace 12 años. Vive en su casa propia en el caserío de Huaylahuichan a lado de sus 2 hijos y esposo. Leonor, empezó con las labores de la agricultura desde joven, poco a poco y gracias a la iniciativa de sus vecinos, pudo ingresar al negocio de la compra y venta de cuyes, los que vende cada semana, ganando de 5 a 10 soles por cuy. Del mismo modo cuenta con una bodega en su casa, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc., obteniendo de 80 a 90 soles diarios. Por su parte, su esposo se dedica al servicio de transporte con un auto de su propiedad.  “He tenido varios problemas en los últimos años, primero la falta de capital, la falta de personal, pérdidas en los sembríos, pero hemos sabido afrontarlos y ahora nos va bien”, comenta Leonor. Ella espera que después de ahorrar lo suficiente, enviar a sus hijos a la ciudad de Lima para que puedan estudiar carreras universitarias y buscar trabajos en distintos ámbitos. Y quizás con el tiempo también irse a vivir con ellos. Con éste sería el préstamo número 13 que Leonor obtendrá de MFP, por lo que necesita de su ayuda para continuar con sus metas. En cuanto a su Banco Comunal comenta que le gusta y se siente cómoda con el sistema de trabajo. Con el dinero Leonor podrá empezar una  nueva siembra para la temporada de abril y mayo, en la que cultivará arvejas, para ello comprará bolsas de abonos. Así también implementará su bodega y si hay suerte comprará una refrigeradora.
texts.en: Leonor is 39 years old. She has been a happily married woman for 12 years. She lives in her own home in the community of Huaylahuichan with her husband and 2 children. Leonor started doing agricultural work when she was young. Little by little, thanks to her neighbors' initiative, she was able to get into the business of buying and selling guinea pigs. She sells them every week, making 5 to 10 soles per cuy. She also has a small store in her house, where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, oil, etc., making 80 to 90 soles a day. Her husband works in transportation with his own car. "I have had several problems in the last few years, first the lack of capital, the lack of personnel, lost crops, but we have been able to face them and now we are fine." Leonor remarks. She hopes that after saving enough, she can send her children to the city of Lima so they can get college educations and look for jobs in different areas. Maybe after time, she will be able to join them. This loan would be the 13th that Leonor will get from MFP, because she needs help to continue with her goals. About the communal bank, she remarks that she likes it and feels comfortable with the work system. With the money, Leonor will be able to start a new crop for the season of April and May. She will plant peas, and for that she will buy bags of fertilizer. She will also outfit her store and with luck she will buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and buy products to outfit his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for three years.
Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for sale. She says that she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Mantic, Tangub City. She is 47 years old. Rebecca is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Rebecca is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo and soaps. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rebecca is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP,  which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora, a 39-year-old widowed mother of two children, lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental where for the past seven years she has had a business selling nutritious snacks. A member of PMPC for seven years, she has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase flour as a primary ingredient of her snack-vending business. In the future, Nora hopes to have her own refreshment business in the area.

loans.use: to purchase flour as a primary ingredient of her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a primary school teacher in his hometown of Litein, South Rift, Kenya, where he also practices farming to supplement his teaching income. He is 26 years old, single, and has been actively farming for six years, producing pineapples and bananas for the local market. He works on the farm himself and employs one farmhand.

Collins has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry for a venture into the poultry farming business. He is optimistic that his farming business will continue to grow due to his experience in farming. He also hopes to build a modern dairy unit for his animals.

He is, however, worried about the increasing costs of animal feed and rampant disease.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en:
Venerando is 51 years old and has six children. He is widowed and stands as both father and mother to his children. He owns a hectare-sized plot of land, where he plants and harvests rice as the source of his income. He usually earns about PHP 15,000 to pay for labor costs and buy equipment used in farming. He pays for laborers who help him transplant rice seedlings. 

He would like to ask for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to pay for labor costs and buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Venerando would like to keep making better sales from his business to allow his family to live comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Roxana Emperatriz

texts.es:
Roxana, es comerciante de verdura, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos quienes están estudiando, sus edades son de 8, 10 y 16 años, ella administra el comercio de verduras y lo realiza por medio de un vehículo en el sale a ofrecer la mercadería, por los cantones y zonas cercanas, tiene una experiencia de 10 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de verdura fresca, papas, güisquiles, repollo, tomates, y otros más que son necesarios en los hogares de los clientes, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad de productos, mejorando sus ventas.
La aspiración de Roxana es que su negocio crezca, pudiendo abarcar más zonas para generar más utilidades y ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana sells vegetales. She lives with her husband, and their three children, who are in school. Their ages are 8, 10, and 16.

She runs a vegetable business, which she does using a vehicle. She goes out to sell the merchandise around the villages and nearby areas. She has 10 years of experience. 

She is applying for a loan to buy fresh vegetables, such as potatoes, gúisquiles (pear squash), cabbages, tomatoes, and others that are needed in customers' homes. This purchase will help her to improve the selection of products, and improve her sales. 

Roxana's ambition is for her business to grow. This will enable her to cover more areas, generate more earnings, and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, gúisquiles (pear squash), cabbages, tomatoes.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en: Thacienne is married to a carpenter. She is 34 years old. She has five children aged between 3 and 15. Four of them go to school. She sells sorghum and she has been running this business for the past five years. With the loan she will buy more sorghum to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for her children. She would like to see her business prospering in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Mwamali

texts.en:
Mwamali is applying for another loan to start a new food stall business. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business. In the future, Mwamali aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwamali has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 28-year-old hard-working man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years he has been riding a motorcycle where he transports people from one destination to the other.He harvested maize in one season and managed to raise two million and two hundred thousand shillings and bought a motorcycle. His business is affected by high fuel costs  and taxes. He would like to work hard to ensure that his children are educated and buy land for  more crop growing.Inorder to increase on his income sources he intends to buy the second mlotorcycle which he intends to hire out and recieve 80% of the daily earnings.
Paul wants a loan to complete payment of his second motorcycle.

loans.use: to complete payment of his second motorcycle.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Mamaliga (Moldovan corn meal dish), Sarmali (grape or garbage leaves rapped around rice and meat) and borsch soup are typical Moldovan foods and delicious.  If there is an event which needs catering in Ungheni people can choose Galina G.’s catering service.  She sells freshly prepared food at a centrally located store in the center of town. She rents out the kitchen in the backroom to prepare her foods with her two women employees which have worked with her for the last 5 years since she started her business.  She originally studied winemaking but decided to switch to catering; she likes to say “It’s something every Moldovan woman just knows how to do.”

Galina would like a loan to buy an electrical oven, a hot water boiler and to stock up an inventory of ingredients for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a hot water heater and an electrical stove

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been taken through the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to do proper book-keeping.

She requires a loan of $750 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: S. Kamal Ziyad Oglu is one of the elder farmers is the region. He lives in Gazanbatan village of the Saatli region. He has a very small farm and to run such a small farm is not effective. So Kamal is going to extend his farm by purchasing additional cows. His farm has sufficient land to provide the animals with feed. He requested from “Agroinvest” 700 USD as credit to buy two cows.

loans.use: Buy two cows and expand his business.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena Ruiz D. G. is 51. She has been married for twenty years and has three children. The oldest son is a first-year law student, while the two girls are still in high school. Maria Elena hopes to see all three complete a university education. A native of Villarrica, Maria Elena moved to Carapeguá nineteen years ago with her husband, a mechanic who runs his own auto body shop. A neighbor woman taught her to weave hammocks and shawls, and since then she has dedicated herself to weaving to earn extra money for her family. Today, Maria Elena is one of the best weavers in the city. She works every day, and when she has a certain number of shawls prepared takes them to shops in the city center to sell, even selling them in neighboring cities. The business has grown in part thanks to previous lines of credit. At this time she would like to borrow $50 to buy cotton thread and cloth and expand her production to meet demand. A member of Fundación Paraguaya since December of last year, Maria Elena is part of the New Horizons Women's Union, a group of fifteen neighbors who together guarantee each loan and pledge to save 10% of their weekly payments.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Elena Ruiz D. G. tiene 51 años está casada hace 20 años, tiene 3 hijos, todos sus hijos estudian actualmente, el mayor está cursando el primer año D. la carrera D. Derecho (Leyes) y sus dos hijas todavía están en la secundaria; su mayor deseo es que puedan terminar sus estudios y obtener títulos universitarios. María Elena es oriunda D. la ciudad D. Villarrica; hace 19 años se mudó a la cuidad D. Carapeguá con su marido, quién es mecánico y tiene su propio taller D. Chapería y Pintura para vehículos. DesD. que llegó a esta ciudad, María Elena, se interesó mucho por el oficio D. tejer mantas y hamacas; las ganas D. aprender y la necesidad D. obtener ingresos extras para el sustento familiar, la llevaron a estudiar las técnicas para elaborar las mantas, fue así que le pidió a su vecina que es tejedora que le enseñe.
