Hoy día, María Elena es una D. las mejores tejedoras D. la ciudad, trabaja todos los días y una vez que tiene una cierta cantidad D. mantas, las lleva a vender a las tiendas del centro y D. otras ciudades aledañas a la D. Carapeguá. Gracias a créditos solicitados anteriormente ella ha podido ir creciendo, hoy día ella está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar hilos D. algodón y telas para aumentar su producción, pues la demanda D. sus mantas a aumentado considerablemente. Ella empezó con la Fundación Paraguaya en Diciembre del año pasado asociándose al Comité D. Mujeres que se formó en su barrio, y hoy día su negocio forma parte del grupo D. microempresas “Mujeres Solidarias Nuevo Horizonte”, conforman el grupo 15 socias, trabajan todas juntas, pagan semanalmente por el préstamo y generan un ahorro del 10% D. sus cuotas; la responsabilidad del crédito es solidario.

loans.use: To buy cotton thread and cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.ru:
Ramiz V. was born in 1951. He has 2 children. Ramiz used to be a truck driver. For the last 2 years, he has been engaged in retail business. Ramiz has been constantly expanding his business. In 2006, he received a loan from Aksu branch of Normicro. Now Ramiz asks for another loan to purchase new inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рамиз Велишов, 1951 года рождения. Раньше был водителям грузовика. Имеет двоих детей. Второй год занимаеться торговли . Ему необходимо было расширять свой бизнес. 2006 году он взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.Сейчас ему нужен кредит чтобы увеличить обьем товаров.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Francisca Abad

texts.en:
Francisca, 57 years old, is a very persistent and optimistic woman. She is married, with eight children (six boys and two girls). They are studying and working in Santo Domingo, the capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Francisca runs a small cafeteria, which she operates all day. In the morning, she serves spaghetti with manioc, manioc with boiled or fried eggs, and chocolate with bread (mixed with peanut butter). For lunch, she prepares and sells white rice with ground meat. At night, Francisca turns her cafeteria into an authentic gathering place. She has laid out a space where the customers can play billiards from 7 p.m. to 12 p.m. On weekends, people can stay until 2:00 am.

For the last two months, the cafeteria has been closed because the entrepreneur was renovating the location so as to offer a better service to her customers. With the loan she has requested, it will be easier for her to invest in the renovation and fix her billiard table. That way, she will continue satisfying her customers’ needs and attract more people with her succulent dishes and through the billiards games.

loans.use: Francisca will use the loan to renovate where she runs the business and fix a billiard table the customers use.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen A.. I am married and a mother of five: three girls and two boys. I live with my family in Raiwind, a small town in Pakistan. At present, only my eldest daughter attends school while the others are small. I embroider clothes on order from my neighborhood clients. I wish to expand my business and buy an embroidery machine for this purpose. Please lend me $250. I hope to secure a sound economic and promising future for my family.

loans.use: Buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Miss Mercy O. is 28 years old, single, and lives in Benin City. Mercy sells bread, beverages & cloth, a business she has been in since 2000. She is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase more stock so she can satisfy more customers. She is a dedicated worker and a LAPO client.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en: Mrs. Krouch L., 40, has been a farmer since 2000 and generally makes about three dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Sok Houy, 29, is a wedding chef making on average, a profit of five dollars per day. This couple has two school-aged children.They would like to use this loan to purchase more pigs to breed and resell them.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Ziyarat

texts.en: Ziyarat is married, and has one child. Her husband is pictured here. She and her family live in Khachmaz, and sells electrical goods for 3 years. Ziyarat and her family would like a loan of $1200 to purchase electrical goods to support their family and improve their  business.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods

loans.name: Jueratu

texts.en: Jueratu A. is a 45 year old mother of 5 and hails from Okoko, Lagos State Nigeria. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks, a skill that she acquired for 3 years. She has being borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years and has been in her business since 1981. She is requesting  a loan of $875 to enable her buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Maya Tzutujil 1 Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Maya Tzutujil 1 has been working with Kiva partner Friendship Bridge for more than a year. Thanks to the good relationship they have with the institution, including facilitator María Quieju, the group has decided to take out another loan.

Within this communal bank, one can find enterprising women of all types – some resell American clothes and sell shoes via catalogue, others are weavers and jewelers, while another section embroiders typical regional blouses called “huipiles”.

The members are going to invest their portion of the loan in their distinctive areas. For example, the weavers are planning to purchase blue, purple and white threads to make huipiles. The embroiderers are planning to purchase threads of all colors to embroider birds, flowers and Mayan symbols on the blouses. Others will invest in the purchase of jewelry beads to make earrings, necklaces, purses, key chains, belts and bracelets. Meanwhile, another member is going to purchase American clothes in the capital to resell in Santiago de Atitlán.

Currently the women are working with another loan financed through “microfinanzas 9” in which they must repay it plus interest in stages every 42 days.

The group decided to opt for this kind of loan due to the fact that the work they do generates income only after some months have passed. For example, the weavers purchase the thread and then a month later they finish the blouse. The embroiderers can take between one and three months to complete their work. For the women who buy and sell American clothing, although they do that fairly quickly, with their margins it takes time for them to generate sufficient income to pay off their debts.

This group of women has already been working together and it’s important to keep supporting it. Their respective businesses have been slowly growing and if we support them now it’s possible for their small businesses to start to take off.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El banco comunal Maya Tzutujil 1 ha venido trabajando con Friendship Bridge por más de un año. Debido a la buena relación que han tenido con la institución, por medio de la facilitadora María Quieju, ellas han decidido sacar otro préstamo.

Dentro de este banco comunal uno puede encontrar empresarias de todo tipo hay quienes revenden ropa americana y venden zapatos por catálogo, otras tejedoras, un grupo que bordan blusas típicas llamadas huipiles, joyeras

Las clientas van a invertir su crédito en distintas áreas. Por ejemplo las tejedoras están pensando en comprar hilos de colores celestes, morados y blancos para tejer huipiles. Las bordadoras están pensando en comprar hilos de todos los colores para bordar aves, flores y símbolos mayas. Otras van a invertir en comprar bolitas de mostacilla para elaborar aretes, collares, monederos, llaveros, cinturones y pulseras. Mientras que una clienta va a comprar ropa americana en la capital para luego revenderla en Santiago de Atitlán.

Actualmente, ellas están trabajando con el producto financiero “microfinanzas 9”. En este producto las mujeres tienen que repagar capital más interés en nueve plazos cada cuarenta y dos días.

Ellas decidieron optar por este producto debido a que el trabajo que tienen genera ingresos después de unos meses. Por ejemplo, las tejedoras compran el hilo y después de un mes terminan un huipil. Las artesanas que bordan huipiles pueden tomarse de uno a tres meses en bordar un huipil. Las mujeres que venden y compran ropa americana a pesar de comprar y vender de manera rápida la utilidad generada por venta es muy poco es por eso que necesitan tiempo para repagar su deuda.

Este grupo de mujeres ya ha venido trabajando juntos y es importante apoyarlas ya que tienen “viada”. Sus respectivos negocios han venido creciendo de a poquitos y si las apoyamos ahora cabe la posibilidad de que sus micro empresas despeguen. ¡Denles esa oportunidad!

loans.use: Purchase beads for jewelry; purchase thread to make and embroider traditional blouses / Comprar mostacilla para elaborar joyas, comprar hilo para elaborar tejidos y bordados tradicionales

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio A. Mollinedo lives with his wife, Anastacia León, in his own home in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz. Eusebio works for a construction company in the city and his wife has a general store in their home.

With prior loans, he built the foundation and main part of his home, and currently he is finishing some of the rooms as well as a small store for the property. The loan he is requesting is to build and finish two rooms on the second floor.

This is the fifth loan he has applied for and the second through Kiva. An analysis rates the loan request favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Eusebio A. Mollinedo vive en casa propia, en la zona de Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Anastacia León. El señor Eusebio es empleado en una empresa constructora de la ciudad y su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio.

Con anteriores créditos realizó la construcción de su vivienda en obra gruesa y actualmente realiza la construcción de las habitaciones en obra fina, así como la tiendita de su propiedad. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones en planta alta.

Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y será la segunda vez a través de Kiva. El análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build 2 rooms on the second floor of his home.

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi F., 40, is married with 5 children and lives in Vaitele on the island of Upolu, Samoa. She has 2 years of experience making hand-painted clothing that she sells in a flea market to the general public six days per week. Her husband helps her run her business.

Lagi has had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (US$104). SPBD loans are Lagi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used for her children's school fees and renovating her house. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase fabric, fabric paints, and brushes for painting clothing for sale.

loans.use: To purchase materials for hand-painted clothing

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng R., age 47, works as a housewife looking after the children and cooking food for the family. Her husband, Hun Tao, 45, has a business catching fish and selling them at the market, earning around $5 in profit each day. This couple has four children, one of whom is a construction worker building houses; one is married, and two are students.

To catch more fish, as it is currently the rainy season, Mrs. Eng would like to borrow fR. Kiva to purchase more fishing implements and nets for her husband. (Mr. Hun is pictured with fishing net.)

loans.use: To purchase more fishing implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a new assortment of clothing to add to her stock

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
S. Suhrob is 31 years old. He and his wife, who is housekeeper, are raising 3 children. Suhrob’s children are small now, but he is already working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. Suhrob sells candies and sweets at the local food market in the city of Dushanbe. Over the past 14 years, Suhrob has acquired the knowledge and skills required to be successful in his business. Since he started his business, he has increased the number of customers and provides them with a good service.

Suhrob requests 3400 Somoni ($1000). He plans to increase the variety of goods that he sells to increase his sales, earn more, and meet the needs of his dearest children. Suhrob thanks everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Etse

texts.fr: Etse K. est un commerçant de petits détails  âgé de 33 ans et réside à Kpalimé au Togo avec sa petite famille.  Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, il espère acheter des sacs de  riz, de sucres, des cartons de laits et autres boîtes de conserves afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Avec cette oportunité, il  espère mieux répondre aux demandes de ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Etse K. is a small-scale retailer. He is 33 years old and lives in Kpalimé, Togo, with his small family. With this third FECECAV loan, he hopes to buy sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, and canned foods in order to expand his commerce. With this opportunity, he hopes to meet the demands of his customers better and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, and canned foods

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
“At first I was timid to invest and establish my own business”, says Evelyn R., a 52-year-old married mother of five children who lives in Talomo District, Davao City. She was hesitant to start her own business until CEV taught her how to operate her own business.

She sells rice, and she tries to earn the respect and trust of the people she sells to which helps promote her business. Evelyn said that being part of CEV help her develop skills and transformed her into a more sociable and vocal person."I deeply thank CEV for the trainings, and now I’m not afraid to speak out, which is really a big help considering that I need to market my product”.

She is requesting another loan from CEV so she can increase her inventory of rice, a main commodity in her area.

Like other CEV clients, she enjoys receiving credit assistance, trainings and Insurance coverage from the organization.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel A. is 30 years old, married and has three children. Currently, all of them are in school. She lives with her family in Odumase, a suburb of Koforidua in the eastern region of Ghana. Here, Rachel makes a living caring for babies and selling infant's clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, bottles and other items. Her experience in this market over the past six has won her many customers, but her major difficulty has been raising funds to expand her business. 

With a loan, she wants to buy more supplies such as clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil and detergent. She believes this will allow her to increase her income and provide her children with a good education. Rachel is a member of the God is King Trust Group, whose members agree to help each other secure and repay loans. 

She does not work on the days when her group meets, and this photo was taken during a meeting.

loans.use: To buy more supplies, such as baby's clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil and detergents

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is a hard-working business lady. She is 43 years old and she is married with 4 children. Gladys is a tailor in Kampala town. She is popular because she is good at making Ugandan traditional outfits ("gomes").

Her courtesy coupled with her 10 years' experience have earned her the loyalty of her customers. The loan is enabling Gladys to purchase more fabric to meet the demand of her customers. She dreams of opening up a fashion and designing school and also of building a modern home for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more fabrics

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer and they live in Jukai neat the Cape Coast. Agnes is a hair dresser who owns a beauty salon, and she has had her business for 17 years.

She has received schooling through Senior high. Agnes uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Agnes will use the loan to purchase some new and varied products.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest in the expansion of her beauty salon.

loans.use: Tto purchase a variety of hair products to meet the demands of her customers who come to the salon.

loans.name: Idomilia

texts.es:
Idomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Idomilia es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hija, Idomilia tiene un puesto en el mercado de las Américas en donde vende ropa, calzados, actividad que realiza los días domingos, mientras los días de semana viaja a las ferias.
Idomilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados para escolares.
Los sueños de Idomilia son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Idomilia is a member of the Banco Comunal Tarpuy, which means "Sowing" in Quechua. Idomilia is 31 years old. She is single and has one daughter. Idomilia has a stand in the Las Américas market, where she sells shoes and clothing every Sunday. During the week she travels to the street markets. Idomilia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy children's shoes. Idomilia dreams of building her own house and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's shoes

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en: Kojo A. is married and has 2 children. He has received no formal education. Kojo sells soft drinks at Bantama in Elmina, which he has done since 2000. His wife is a fish dealer. Kojo uses his income to provide food, clothing, and other basic necessities for his family. Kojo will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by his costumers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo plans to save towards a house he wants to build so that he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: Kojo will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by his costumers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen T., 57 years old, is married and a resident of Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer and they have 3 children. They have been in sari-sari store business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to expand her store.

Carmen and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail loan because they wanted to buy additional inventories. But aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of PHP 4,000. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience & diligence of her husband she is looking forward to being successful vendor someday.

loans.use: Expansion of her variety store

loans.name: Jenan

texts.en:
Jenan is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Jenan has owned a grocery store for a year. She requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Jenan has requested a loan.

Jenan is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the start-up capital. Jenan decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, as well as she wanted to have independent work. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

loans.use: Jenan will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C., a 49-year old farmer and mother of two children, now owns the land she previously rented, growing rice as her main crop.  Her agricultural income has enabled her to buy appliances such as a refrigerator and television.  Gloria is now requesting a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI to buy 40 liters of crude oil, rice seeds and fertilizers, all of which will really help her improve the harvest. 
	
CEVI provides with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 40 liters of crude oil, rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rafiu

texts.en:
Rafiu is 33 years old and single without a child. He is an aluminum fabricator and makes aluminum windows.

He is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more fabricating materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fabricating materials

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
After the death of her husband, Florita E. thought that she has no more reason to live. But her nine children encouraged her to live. Good thing that she has a farm business that keeps her busy all the time. At least, she sometimes forgets to weep and mourn. 

Now, she is busy managing a farm. She wanted to make the farm productive in memory of her husband who was a good farmer.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm needs. The loan will help improve her yield. In that way, she could give her children a share to support their children also.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm needs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 54, married and a mother with six children. Among the children, one is schooling and the rest are currently working. Margaret is a resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food for the children. She is a petty trader who sells in the community market of Sefwi Bekwai, where she lives. She sells items like cassava, spices, vegetables, yams, etc., and she has been in business for 30 years. She requests a loan to buy more foodstuffs like cassava, yams, vegetables, etc. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cassava, yams, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou P. est une veuve avec 16 enfants dont l’aîné assure les charges familiales. Elle souhaiterait ce prêt pour s’activer dans la vente de mangue afin d’aider aux dépenses pour mieux améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou P. is a widow with 16 children. Her eldest son provides for the family. She would like to use this loan to sell mangoes, in order to help with the family expenses and to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell mangoes

loans.name: Azamchon

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Аъзамчон, мужчина торгует на Афганбазаре 1001 мелочами. Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. Спрос на его товар большой из за качества товаров. Период кредитование он увеличил товарооборот и прибыль своей семье.Он планирует на запрашиваемый займ закупить мелкий товар  для быта.
texts.en:
Azamchon A. is a man who sells a thousand and one items on the Afganbazar market. He buys the merchandise on the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. The demand for the goods is high because of the quality of the items. During his credit history he has increased turnover and profit for his family. He plans to use the loan to buy small items for the household.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batteries, hairclips, hair color.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelino Ávalos  tiene 28 años de edad y  vive en concubinato con   la Sra.  María Ayala  hace más  de 8 años, tienen  dos hijos uno  de 8 años que esta en etapa escolar  y el otro tiene  3 años.   

             Desde   muy  joven se dedicó a la venta ambulante,  su madre se encargaba de la  elaboración de  los  productos  y  el se encargaba de distribuir la  producción , trabajaron  juntos durante  10 años  mas adelante se independizó  y busco  nuevas  zonas  de trabajo  por cuenta propia,  trasladándose  en su motocicleta ya que es la manera  mas ágil de realizar  mayor recorrido. Hoy  día  cuenta con  mas de 300 clientes y su  actividad  le genera muy buen  ingreso 
 Gracias a este trabajo logró brindar una modesta casa a su familia 
                   Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sabanas.

loans.use: Compra de sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sabanas

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 23-year-old married young woman with one child who is breastfeeding. Janet is an achiever and her hard work contributes earnestly to her family.

Janet is a food vendor and sells rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of raw materials from Dwinase, which is a nearby market where she has access to stock. She has been in the business for the last two years, supporting the husband in taking care of the home.

Janet says demand for her food is on the high side but she does not have enough money to meet the demand. She requests the loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables, etc. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables and bags of rice

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie A. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 50 years old. Rosie is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zaki Group

texts.en:
Zaki is the group leader of the Zaki group. There are three members in this group. They all want take a loan to improve and enlarge their businesses.

Zaki requests a loan for her husband, who has car parts shop. Zhara requests a loan for her carpet weaving business. Halima requests a loan for her embroidery business. So they are requesting a group loan of 15000 Afghani. They thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Improve and enlarge auto parts shop, carpet weaving business, and embroidery business

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul T. is 47 years old and a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory.

Hul T. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time so that she can support her family. Hul T. faces difficulty with her living condition because the roof of her house is falling down; thus, she applies for a loan to pay the cost of repairing the roof.

loans.use: To pay the cost of repairing her roof

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old; she is married and has seven children. She is committed and a very hard-working lady. She believes in assisting her husband in running the home financially and otherwise. 

Mary is into poultry farming. She has been in the poultry business for years and with it she sustains her family. She buys her stock from the local market and sells to her customers. Most of the challenges she faces in her chicken business is when she purchases sick chickens without knowing it and the transportation costs, which are very high in the area. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more chickens and poultry feed. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and feed

loans.name: Karen Lizeth

texts.es: Karen Lizeth R. R.  de 32 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, negocio el cual les ha permitido tener una vida estable, Karen desea ampliar su negocio y poder surtirlo con bebidas frías, ya que estas son muy vendidas en el lugar en el cual vive, es por esto que solícita un préstamo para poder tener la capacidad económica de comprar dichas bebidas.
texts.en:
Karen Lizeth R. R. is 32 years old, lives in the Ahuachapán district with her husband and three young children. She owns a perishable goods store, a business which has allowed her to lead a stable life. Karen wants to enlarge her business and be able to supply it with cold drinks, since these sell well in the area where she lives. This is why she is seeking a loan to be able to have the economic ability to buy these drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cold drinks

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una mujer de 44 años que durante toda su vida ha trabajado muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Vive en la casa de unos familiares y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
En la feria Dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, Sebastiana aprovecha para vender los juguetes de segunda mano que compra en el país de Bolivia. Los juguetes que trae están muy bien cuidados, además que ella les da una lavada para desinfectarlos antes de venderlos, motivos por los cuales se venden rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la cara de alegría, que los niños ponen cuando tiene uno de sus juguetes en sus manos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus muñecos de peluche, ya que los fardos son muy pesados y se cansa mucho. 
Para más adelante espera tener un puesto estable para vender sus juguetes, ya que actualmente lo hace de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Sebastiana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fardos de juguetes para tener más mercadería que vender.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 44-year old woman who, throughout her whole life, has worked very hard to succeed in life. She lives in the house of a relative, and what she wishes for most is to live out her old age in peace. Sebastiana sells used toys she buys in Bolivia at the Sunday market in the city of Juliaca. The toys she brings are in excellent shape, and she also washes them so they are disinfected before she offers them for sale. For this reason, they sell quickly. What she enjoys most about her work is seeing the smiles on the children’s faces when they hold one of her toys in their hands. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years, and finds the most difficult aspect of her work to be transporting her stuffed animals as the bundles are very heavy and she gets tired. In the future, she would like to have a stationary location where she could sell her products since she currently works as a street vendor. This is Sebastiana’s sixth loan with MFP, and she knows she must make her payments on time and is committed to do so. She is known as a responsible member of her cooperative bank, and is aware that she must comply with the agreements made among members. She will use the 1,500.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy additional bundles of toys, so she will have additional more merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn S. is from the city of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old. Emelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. Emelyn owns & operates a retail store selling used shoes and clothes in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kujang

texts.en:
Kujang M. is currently in the business of selling beer and sodas. She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Kujang is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Electina

texts.en:
Electina N. is a businesswoman who lives in Kwirare, Busia District. She is aged 30 years, is married, and is the mother of three children.

Electina’s tailoring business dates back to 2005 after she quit her subsistence farming that was not generating any income for the family.

Electina travels as far as Malaba for her stock on a monthly basis but this is not yet enough as she wants to expand her business by increasing her stock. That will put her in a better position to educate her children. She wishes to obtain a loan of Ksh 20,000 to be able to achieve this.

loans.use: To increase her stock and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cola nuts

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 60-year-old married man and father of one child. He is an experienced fisherman and has worked in this business for over 13 years. He owns a fish cart to present his products to customers. His products are in great demand because he sells fresh fish and has a good reputation.
Today, he is asking to borrow $800 USD to buy more fish. In this way, he hopes to increase his productivity and profits and maintain a strong reputation in his business. He will buy from a fish market we work with in an area specializing in fishing.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio trabaja como transportista de carga (papa, chuño – es papa que ha sido procesada de diferente manera -, carne de cerdo) la esposa es comerciante de carne de cerdo por kilo; estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos. Vive en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará a comprar un motor para su movilidad para continuar trabajado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado por Julio.
texts.en:
Julio works transporting cargo. He transports potatoes, “chuño” (potato that has been processed in a different way), and pork. His wife is a merchant who sells pork by the kilo. These two activities are their primary sources of income, which support their two children. They live in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy a motor for his vehicle in order to keep working. It is his second loan with Impro. His good payment history allows for approval of Julio’s requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor for his vehicle, which he uses to transport cargo

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es socio del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Jose es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Jose tiene dos restaurantes que están ubicados en locales alquilados, Jose cuenta con el apoyo de personal que ayudan en la cocina y atención.
Jose necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de utensilios de cocina.
Los sueños de Jose son tener una cadena de restaurantes y una galería.
texts.en:
Jose is a member of the community bank Santa Elena. Jose is 44 years old. He has a live-in partner and three children. He has two restaurants located in rented spaces. Jose counts on the support of his staff who help in the kitchen and serving customers. Jose needs a loan for 1500 soles, money he will use for the purchase of kitchen utensils. Jose's dreams are to have his own chain of restaurants and a gallery.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying kitchen utensils

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old and married with two children who go to school. He runs a shop where he sells general merchandise such as rice, sugar, plastics, cooking fat and cereals to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has many customers due to his good customer care skills. He talks to his customers well and gives credit to his best customers which keeps them returning.

He saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya called Mwimuto Success which enables him to access loans because the group guarantees.  He hopes to grow his business and open branches in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of flour, rice and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy more flour, rice and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. a 20 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant. Depuis le 02 avril 2007 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA. Elle fait de la restauration depuis qu'elle a commencé à contracter un crédit. Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte augmenter sa capacité de production en achetant beaucoup plus de riz et d'huile végétale et d'autres condiments de cuisine. Son objectif est de pendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de soutenir ses parents pour leur en charge.
texts.en:
Khady D. is 20 years old, unmarried without children. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 2 April 2007. She has been in the restaurant business since she was granted her first loan. This new loan will enable her to increase her production capacity by buying much more rice, vegetable oil, and other cooking condiments. Her objective is to manage her own personal needs and to support her parents who are still caring for her.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Mirador De Matilde Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. María Alicia F. que es el lugar en donde se realizan las reuniones semanales, como podemos observar en la foto están las 12 integrantes que forman el grupo denominado “Mirador de Matilde” haciendo alarde a su ubicación en el estado de Hidalgo.
Ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales trabajan y le ayudan con algunos de los gastos de los servicios de su casa, se dedica a la venta de pollo, requiere del crédito para invertir en la compra de una nueva bascula ya que la que tiene no sirve muy bien, al igual desea pintar su negocio para que luzca lo mejor posible. Nos comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábados arduamente con el afán de crear un ahorro para cuando ya no tenga las fuerzas necesarias para trabajar, pero por el momento disfruta mucho de su negocio y lo que más le agrada es el trato con sus clientas.

La tesorera del grupo es la Sra. Martha Silvia N. que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace 8 años, vive en unión libre, tiene dos hijos de 24 y 13 años de edad,  ella obtuvo su crédito para poder invertir en una mayor cantidad de productos ya que lo compra a un precio más económico y así poder obtener una mayor ganancia, cuenta con una gran número de clientes esto debido a los años de  experiencia en la venta de estos productos. 

Las integrantes de este grupo son mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras, la Sra. Gizeh G., por ejemplo, de 24 años de edad y con un hijo de 5 años, es casada y se dedica a la venta de regalos, ella obtuvo su crédito para invertir en material para decorar los regalos que le llevan para envolver y también para comprar los cristales de su mostrador los cuales algunos ya estaban rotos, en este momento es lo que necesita en su negocio para poder obtener un poco más de ganancia. Considera que el éxito es el resultado del trabajo de cada día, y le gustaría ver que su negocio crezca de manera importante porque sabe que con ello les podrá ofrecer una mejor  vida su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Maria Alicia F., which is where the group meets weekly. As we can see in the photo, there are 12 members in the group named Mirador de Matilde, to showcase their location in the state of Hidalgo. Maria Alicia is a single mother of two children, who work and help her with some of the household expenses. She sells chicken and is requesting this loan to invest in a new scale, because the one she has does not work well. She also wants to paint her business so that it will look its best. She mentions that she works very hard, Monday to Saturday, with the aim of saving up for when she is no longer able to work. However, for now she greatly enjoys her business and the most gratifying element is her rapport with her customers. The group's treasurer is Martha Silvia F., who has sold beauty products through a catalogue for 8 years. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children ages 24 and 13. She is requesting this loan to invest in a larger inventory which she will buy at a lower price and thus be able to make more profit. She has a large number of customers thanks to her years of experience selling these products. The group members are hard-working and enterprising women; Gizeh B., for example, is 24, married and has a 5-year-old child. She sells gifts and will invest her credit in material to decorate the gifts she wraps, and to buy glass for her display case, since some of the panes are broken. At this moment, this is what she needs for her business in order to earn a little bit more. She believes that success is the result of daily work, and she would like to see her business grow significantly because she knows that with it she will be able to offer her little child a better life. The other group members are: Elvira Hernández Ramírez Quilt sales Yadira Martínez D. J. Bag sales María Judith O. R. Electrical equipment sales Ma. Dolores M. Juárez Footwear sales Mónica Elvira O. Z. Fuller cosmetics sales Carmela P. F. Craft sales Judith R. P. Clothing sales Sarai R. P. Quilt sales Gloria Velázquez A. Candy sales

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new scale, giftwrap, etc

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Julio (35), con quien tiene 2 pequeños hijos.En  los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres, cultiva café, frutas cítricas y plátano, desde hace 15 años. Mientras su esposo labora como conductor de vehículos pesados en la municipalidad de la ciudad. Durante los fines de semana, ella y su esposo cuidan  adecuadamente sus plantaciones, y lo que más le gusta a Norma es cosechar, porque puede vender a buen precio los frutos que recolectó para volverlos a invertir nuevamente para mejorar su producción. Esta actividad le resulta muy rentable, porque puede solventar tranquilamente sus gastos, también puede vivir cómodamente y brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, además de ahorrar para grandes proyectos futuros, pues confiesa que para más adelante, tiene planeado adquirir un fundo turístico y plantar mayor cantidad de  productos naturales que crecen en la selva central del Perú.Es  la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y dice  que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, porque ahorra  y aprende de las charlas educativas que le brinda esta entidad financiera.      Norma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  4 mil plantas de café y varios sacos de abono que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Norma, who is 35, lives in her own house with her husband Julio, 35, with whom she has two small children. For 15 years she has cultivated coffee, citrus fruits, and bananas on the land she inherited from her parents. Meanwhile, her husband works as a driver of heavy vehicles for the city. During the weekends, she and her husband provide appropriate care for her plantings. What Norma likes most is harvesting, because she can sell the fruits that she gathers at a good price, which she can reinvest to improve her production. This activity is very profitable for her, because she can pay her expenses without any worry, and she can also live comfortably and offer the best to her children. In addition, she can save for big future projects, since she confesses that in the future, she is planning to acquire a rural property and plant a larger quantity of natural products that grow in the central jungle of Peru. This is her third loan with MFP, and she says that she likes to work with her community bank because she saves and learns from the educational talks that this institution offers. Norma plans to invest the loan in the purchase of four thousand coffee plants and a number of sacks of fertilizer which she needs to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plants and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Ignacio Fredy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Fredy; el socio  tiene 47 años de edad y el socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. El socio se dedica a la venta de materiales de calzados, y a la venta de calzados ortopédicos en el mercado de Huanchac el socio tienen un stand desde hace 2 años, El socio trabaja con su conyugue y ambos fabrican estos calzados y los venden al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas comerciales. Él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y de este modo seguir con su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Arcángel Gabriel Communal Bank. The member lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Fredy is the member. He is 47 years old, and he is in a common law marriage. He has two children. Fredy sells footwear materials and orthopedic footwear in the Huanchac market. He has had a stand for two years. He works with his life partner, and they both make footwear. They sell it wholesale to different stores. The member is requesting a loan to buy materials. This is how he will continue with his business. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. The loan allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. He pledges to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to continue with his business

loans.name: Mirna Yanira

texts.es: Mirna Yanira M. D. D. D. 32 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como profesor D. natación y junto a sus dos hijos D. 10 y 7 años D. edad, los cuales se dedica a estudiar, ella vive junto a su familia en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Mirna posee una venta D. productos deportivos, como zapatos, trajes D. baño, todo lo relacionado con la natación, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en el polideportivo D. Merliot, mismo lugar en el cual su esposo da las clases D. natación, debido al buen desempeño del esposo D. Mirna en su trabajo, le fue concedido un pequeño local para poder colocar una tienda D. accesorios como sandalias, y así mismo bebidas como: agua y sodas, esto ha sido una gran oportunidad, ya que le ha brindado una nueva fuente D. ingresos para su familia. Mirna solicita un préstamo para poder comprar zapatos tenis, D. una marca en especifico, así mismo comprar más trajes D. baño, tablas para las clases D. natación y otros productos más los cuales venD. muy bien en el lugar. El mayor deseo D. Mirna es el D. poder aprovechar al máximo la oportunidad brindada y D. esta forma mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna Yanira M. D. D. is 32 years old. She lives with her husband, a swimming instructor, and their two children. The children are ten and seven years old, and they go to school. She lives with her family in Antiguo Cuscatlán, which is located in the La Libertad department. Mirna sells sporting goods like shoes, bathing suits, and everything having to do with swimming. Her business is located in the Merliot sports center, which is the same place where her husband teaches swimming. Due to her husband’s good work, she was granted a small place. She was able to set up a store with accessories like sandals. She also sells drinks like water and soda. This has been a great opportunity because it has been a new source of income for her family. Mirna is requesting loan to be able to buy a specific brand of tennis shoes. She will also buy more bathing suits, kick boards for swimming class, and other products; which sell very well at her place. Mirna’s greatest wish is to be able to take maximum advantage of the opportunity offered in order to improver her quality of life as well as her family’s.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes, kick boards for swimming, and other products

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Sok S.. She is 47 and lives in the province of Battambang in Cambodia, about 300 km from Phnom Penh along National Road No. 5. Sok S. earns a living by planting vegetables. She grows them both for eating and selling. Her husband works with her in the field. This couple has given birth to five kids who are in school. Sok S. lives in an older house that is often broken down, and their living situation has been affected. Sok S. is, therefore, asking for a loan to repair the house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Aiganysh

texts.en:
Aiganysh D. is a resident of Tup, a nice town in the Isykul region with a population of 15,000 people. She is a 54-year-old widow. She has raised two daughters and four sons. The daughters are married and live separately with their families and the sons are working, except for the youngest son who studies at school. 

Aiganysh works as a teacher of physics at the school. She is also engaged in farming. In 1995 when the collective farms broke up, she got a parcel of land where she cultivates fruits and vegetables.  She also sells milk for making money. 

With the money received from the loan, Aiganysh wants to purchase 400 liters of fuel which is needed for the sowing process. In the future she wants to see her sons get married. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for the planting season

loans.name: Tlatoani Group

texts.es:
Este Grupo solidario se llama Tlatoani, esta ubicado en Tlayacapan, en el estado de Morelos, esta conformado por 4 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinos y están muy contentos con el préstamo que le proporcionan.
Los integrantes del grupo son el señor Eutimio Gómez T. va a comprar con su préstamo madera (polines), tablas, etc. para tener madera para cimbrar el es albañil, el señor Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez va a comprar hojas para tamal, carne, chiles secos, leche, canela, azúcar, arroz para elaborar sus tamales y su atole, la señora Antolina Cornelio X. F. va a comprar catálogos nuevos para surtirse de blancos, colchas, sabanas matrimoniales e individuales, la señora Maria Elena O. M. va a comprar una parrilla, mesas, y mercancía elotes por bulto, queso por kilo, chile en polvo por kilo para preparar sus elotes, esquites y chile atole.
El señor Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez es el representante del grupo, tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, vive en unión Libre tiene 1 hija de 6 años de edad se llama Anel y estudia la primaria, el señor Humberto solicito su préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de atole y tamales va a comprar Hojas para tamal, manteca, carne, vasos, cucharas, servilletas, papel extraza, azúcar, chiles guagillo, masa, leche, canela, arroz, inicio su negocio hace 20 años por necesidades económicas por que en el campo no había trabajo, trabajaba 1 día o dos días de la semana y se le ocurrió comenzar a vender atole y tamales, le va muy bien en el negocio, inicio vendiendo su producto en cubetas, caminando fue ahorrando y compro su triciclo donde se desplaza mas fácilmente en todo el pueblo, en la gasolinera, en la orilla de la carretera donde va ofreciendo sus tamales y atole, sus clientes son todas la personas del pueblo y los turistas que se detienen a comprar ornatos de barro y alfarería, el  se siente orgulloso de tener este negocio por que le a permitido comprar su terreno donde esta viviendo y esta construyendo su casa de material,  su casa donde vive es de madera y techo de lamina pero están ahorrando para poner las bardas de tabique y el techo de concreto, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de otros compañeros que venden los mismos productos. Las ganancia que obtiene las reparte en los gastos de la familia, en mampostería de la casa e invirtiendo en los insumos para volver a vender el atole y los tamales. Lo que mas le ha gusta es cuando vende y recibe el dinero, es importante por que de ahí comen y es el sostén de la familia. Sus sueños son hacer su casa verla terminada y bonita también que su hija siga estudiando para que tenga su carrera y un buen empleo. El esta feliz y contento, lleno de salud con el préstamo que le proporcionan  y quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas Gracias que confían en nosotros y que nos sigan prestando” 
En el Pueblo de Tlayacapan hay mucha tranquilidad, todos se conoce y son muy amistosos, es turístico venden productos de alfareria, esta muy bonito esta verde, tiene historia mágica por su cerros que se llaman el sombrerito, mariposa, la ventanilla, la iglesia es exconvento, también es la cuna de los chinelos, en el mes de Febrero o marzo 5 días antes del miércoles de ceniza, hay fiesta en el pueblo desde el viernes al martes.
texts.en:
This group is named Tlatoani and it is located in Tlayacapan in the state of Morelos. It is made up of 4 members. They all know each other and are neighbors. They are all very happy for the loan they have requested. Eutimio G. Torrez will purchase wood and wood planks with his loan to use in his work. He is a construction worker. Humberto Eduardo M. R. will purchase corn husks, meat, dried chilies, milk, sugar, cinnamon and rice to make tamales and warm corn flour drinks. Antolina Cornelio X. F. will purchase new catalogues to restock her business with linen and blankets in various sizes. Maria Elena O. M. will purchase a grill, chairs, sacks of corn on the cob, cheeses, powdered chili for the corn, and for corn drink. Humberto Eduardo M. R. is the representative of the group. He is 40 years old and he has a grade 9 education. He lives together with his wife and their 6-year old daughter named Anel. She attends primary school. Humberto requests a loan to invest in his business, selling corn flour drinks and tamales. He will use it to purchase corn husks, lard, meats, cups, spoons, napkins, sugar, chilies, corn flour, milk, cinnamon and rice. He started his business 20 years ago for the lack of paid work. He used to work one or two days a week so he started selling corn drinks and tamales. His business has been very successful. He started out selling his products from buckets but with time he started to save money and he purchased an adult tricycle which helped him to go all over town. He goes to gas stations and along the streets to sell his corn drinks and tamales. He sells to the entire population of the village and to tourists that stop to purchase ornate clay objects and pottery. He is proud of his business because with it he has been able to purchase a plot of land where he lives and where he is building a house. The house where he lives is made of wood and aluminum sheeting, but he is saving money to make the walls out of bricks and the roof of concrete. He faces competition from others that work in the same business, selling the same products. He invests his earnings in part to cover the family’s expenses, in part to continue building their house, and he also invests a part of his earnings back into the business. What he enjoys most of his work is completing a sale. It is very important because it feeds and supports his family. His dreams are to see his house completed and beautiful. He also wishes to see his daughter attend school and achieve a career and a have a good job. He is very happy and content and in good health. He is glad about the loan he is granted he wishes to thank Kiva and Fundacion Realidad for the trust imparted to them by this loan and future loans. The village of Tlayacapan is quiet and clam and every one knows the members of the group. The region is very friendly and it is known by tourists for its clay pottery. It is a lovely village where everything is green with vegetation and there is a magical history of the surrounding mountains, commonly known as The Little Sombrero, Butterfly, and The Little Window. The church was once a convent. It is also the birthplace of chinelos, colorfully dressed dancers. In the months of February and March up to 5 days before Ash Wednesday there are weekly fairs, on Friday to Tuesday every week.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn husks, lard, meats, cups, spoons, napkins, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Merrylou

texts.en:
Merrylou C. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Merrylou is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merrylou owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Merrylou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merrylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merrylou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merrylou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.en:
D. Sadullo has been selling cattle for more than 17 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He's the father of five children who all need to be fed and provided with the necessary education. One of his main needs is the need to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason Sadullo went to IMON International and requested a loan of 1000 USD. Not only will his business benefit from it, so will his family. Your support will really help him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es: La señora Verónica tiene como principal actividad económica la venta a crédito de frazadas, colchas, cocinas, garrafas y víveres, ella comenzó con esta actividad hace cuatro años, en un principio vendía zapatos para señoras de pollera puesto que su familia se dedica a la fabricación de este producto, tiene una pequeña hija y su esposo se dedica a trabajos de albañilería, con esfuerzo pudieron comprar una mezcladora para así facilitar el trabajo del esposo, en primera instancia formó parte del Banco de Emprendimiento "LAS AMIGAS" demostrando responsabilidad con el cargo que desempeñaba ( Secretaria de Actas) y puntualidad en sus pagos. Viven en casa de sus padres y en un futuro piensan comprar su propio domicilio para dar comodidad a su pequeña hija, el destino del crédito es para incrementar su capital, comprando mercadería ya que tiene muchos pedidos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica’s primary business is selling blankets, bedspreads, stoves, tanks of natural gas, and groceries. She started her business four years ago by selling women’s shoes and traditional clothing that her family manufactured. Veronica has a young daughter and her husband works as a mason. After some effort, she was able to buy a cement mixer to help make her husband’s job easier.

Veronica started out by joining the Communal Bank “Las Amigas” (The Friends). She demonstrated that she was responsible by serving as the Secretary of Records and submitting her payments on time. Veronica lives at her parents’ house and plans to buy her own home in the future so that her young daughter will be more comfortable.

This loan will be used to increase her operating capital. Veronica will buy merchandise for the many orders she has already received. She is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to fulfill her orders

loans.name: Seeten

texts.en:
Seeten S. is a 51-year-old widow who lives with her son in Bayanhoshuu Mongolia. Her 18 year-old son attends high school. She and her son live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and Seeten operates a hair salon in her town. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2007 and has built a stable operation. 

For the future, Seeten hopes to expand her business and provide a good education for her son. She needs funds to expand her workplace and she would like to start selling cosmetics at her hair salon. Seeten is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and earnings.

loans.use: to increase working capital and start selling cosmetics

loans.name: Cusco Sur Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CUSCO SUR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. María Elena; ella tiene 33 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. flores y también se dedica a la venta D. artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado llamado Ccascaparo en el distrito D. la ciudad D. Cusco donD. venD. las flores y en forma independiente también hace aretes y los venD., la socia trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y por medio D. estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar flores y comprar materiales para hacer los aretes.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. flores, restaurant, tienda D. abarrotes, artesanía, venta D. productos D. belleza y  producción D. aretes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Cusco Sur Community Bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Maria Elena is 33 years old and is single with three children. She works selling flowers and handcrafts. She has a small stand in a market called Cascaparo in an area in the city of Cusco where they sell flowers. Independent of this work she makes and sells earrings. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. and through these small businesses help her proviD. for her children. She hopes to grow her business. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase flowers and the materials to make earrings. The other members have a variety of businesses such as selling flowers, restaurants, convenience store, handcrafts store, cosmetics store, and earrings.

Maria Elena is thankful for those who help her fulfill her dreams through this opportunity and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar flores y comprar materiales para hacer los aretes.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in Lahore which is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives in the area named Ismail Nagar with her family in a 2 room brick house. She has been living there for over 10 years. Robina is a caring lady. She  prefers to stays at home and carried out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. Her elder son works with his father and helps him in his business. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s floor tile business. He has a shop from where he sells floor tiles of different colors and designs to his customers and earns income for the family. With the loan, he will put more tiles of different designs in his shop and improve his sales.  Robina is very confident that this investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and it will help her family to enjoy better standard of life
. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy floor tiles to sell

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 34 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 12 years old. Alphonsine makes a living by selling stationery. Her business is open from 7:30 a.m. until 9:30 p.m. every day. Her store is spacious and well-organized.

Alphonsine has requested a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing more stationery. Alphonsine hopes to reinvest any profits she makes and be able to pay school fees too.

loans.use: To purchase more books and other stationery supplies

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen N., 41, is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a machine to improve his furniture business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. 

N. produces wooden furniture to sell, earning a gross income of $30 per day. N. is married and resides with his wife and two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. 

The family has to spend $66 on food, $20 on electricity supply, and $33 on other necessary expenses every month.  

This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a machine to improve the furniture business

loans.name: Robert Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Robert is 27 years old and married to Regina Wairimu, who contributes to the family income. He has been selling clothes and umbrella shades for four years with an income of KES 5,000 per month. 

Robert has never borrowed from any other MFI. This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy more clothes and umbrellas to resell. He hopes to expand his business and open a shop to sell shoes and improve his family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and umbrellas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children who are attending school. He has owned a fruit and vegetable shop since 2006. He sells his products to people from his community. He is the only income source of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory so that he could improve his business, increasing his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Abass

texts.ar:
عباس في عمر 32 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في بيع الحديد وتصنيعه له في عمله نحو16 سنة يحب عمله ويتقنه جيدا يريد التطور
والتجدد في العمل يسعى الى زيادة تأمين منزل للعائلة ولذلك فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء قطعة ارض
له في قريته حيث تعيش العائلة وتكون عائلته قريبا من عمله عباس طموح جدا ومتطور في عمله وله زبائن كثر من محيطه 
وجيرانه وهو مقصد للعمل حيث انه يتقن فن الزخرفة في الحديد وصنع الادوات المنزلية
texts.en: Abass, 32, is married with one son. He has been working for 16 years in manufacturing and selling iron rods. Abass is a hard worker who likes to be up-to-date at work. He wants to get a loan from A. Majmoua to buy a plot of land in the village where his family lives. He wants to build a house there so that he and his family can live near his workplace.  He is very ambitious and has many clients from his neighbors and the people who know him.  He is known for his good work. Abass excels in iron handicraft and in making utensils.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land on which to build a house for his family

loans.name: Baloon Group

texts.en:
Khalid S., who is in his mid-forties, is married with two children.  He sells fish at Afrikan, a place just outside the city centre. He works from 6:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Khalid's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his stock of fish, and he bought a plot of land and has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants to use this loan to make some bricks to develope his land which he bought in his last loan. His dream is to further increase his stock of fish.

Khalid will share this loan with his loan group "Baloon", which has a total of 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Khalid is in front wearing a dark blue T-shirt, second from left.

loans.use: To make some bricks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijos adolescentes que le ayudan a salir adelante, pues desean juntos alcanzar el progreso. Desde muy joven, esta emprendedora mujer observaba como su padre confeccionista realizaba cortinas y  desde entonces empezó su afán por aprender a confeccionar. Cuando debió sacar adelante a sus hijos no dudo en continuar con todo lo aprendido y empezó con la producción de prendas de vestir. En la actualidad esta muy satisfecha pues tiene varios pedidos de prendas, pues por temporadas le encargan y ella trata de cumplir con todos con la ayuda de su hija de 15 años, quien domina muy bien la máquina de coser. Dice que los colegios de la zona también le encargan pedidos de buzos y uniformes escolares por lo que tiene pedidos con frecuencia y esta vez tiene un gran pedido pero no tiene capital para concretarlo, es por esta razón que solicita el crédito. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar dos máquinas más de coser para que su hijo mayor le ayude y así continuar progresando en este rubro. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible que pueda continuar con su negocio. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de diversas telas que necesita para continuar con la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old and she lives in her own home together with her two adolescent children. They contribute and together they want to progress. Since she was very young, this enterprising woman she learned from her father when he made curtains. Since then it has been her focus to learn to sew. When she needed to provide for her children she had no doubt about using the skills that she learned and she started making articles of clothing. She is very happy because she has various orders that are placed for the season and she tries to fill them all with the help of her 15-year old daughter who excels in using the sewing machine.  She says that the schools in the region also place orders for jackets and school uniforms which is why she often has orders. But this time she has received a large order and she doesn't have the capital funds to fill it, which is why she requests a loan. For the future she plans on purchasing two sewing machines so that her eldest daughter will help her and therefore continue progressing in the business. Maria plans on investing the loan she requests on purchasing a variety of fabrics that she needs to keep making articles of clothing, and in this manner continue to advance.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to make articles of clothing

loans.name: Dina Argelia

texts.es:
Doña Dina, tiene 67 años D. edad, es dueña D. una ferretería, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera,  departamento D. Morazán, vive con su hijo llamado  Anner; él negocio lo atienD. en su casa durante la semana D. lunes a sábado y el domingo se traslada al mercado, a ofrece los artículos.
Ella quiere invertir al negocio, comprando martillo, barra D. metal, pegamento industrial, y a través D. este préstamo podrá conseguir la mercadería para fortalecer el negocio,  ofreciendo mejor variedad D. herramientas y dando para una mejor atención a los clientes.
El objetivo D. doña Dina es tener mayor estabilidad en el negocio, por largo plazo, para garantizar los ingresos para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
