Dina is 67 years old. She is the owner of a hardware store. She lives in San Francisco Gotera,  departament of Morazán. She lives with her son, named  Anner. She works at the business in her house during the week from Monday through Saturday. Sundays she goes to the market to sell her items.  

She wants to invest in the business, buying hammers, metal rods and industrial glue. In this way, she will be able to have the merchandise to strengthen her business, offering a better variety of tools and giving her customers better service. 

Dina's goal is to have more stability in her business in the long term, and guarantee income for her and her son.

loans.use: to buy tools (hammers, metal rods, industrial glue).

loans.name: Miriam Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Miriam es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y por la oportunidad de continuar con su negocio. Tiene  38 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 13 años la misma que estudian en colegio, vive en casa de la mamá.

Además de ser una muy buena madre, también se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo como ropa, artículos plásticos y para el hogar, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por las mañanas, lleva varios años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. También realiza trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal, sus trabajos  los realiza tanto en su casa como a domicilio, nos cuenta que cuando realiza sus trabajos también ofrece sus productos.

Este crédito es para comprar productos plásticos, artículos para el hogar y ropa ya que tiene varios pedidos.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of El Progreso in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank ILUSIONES meets every two weeks.  This is a marginal urban area of the city which is densley populated.  It is known as the jail sector since the Portoviejo women's prison is located here.

Mrs. Miriam is a founding member of the communal bank which she enjoys because of the low interest rates it gives compared to other loan institutions and because it allows her to continue her business.  She is 38 years old, a single mother and has a 13-year-old daughter who is in school.  They live with Miriam's mother.

In addition to being a good mother, she also is a merchant and sells products by catalogue such as clothing, plastic articles and household items.  She sells on a door-to-door basis and works every day in the mornings.  She has been involved in this activity for several years and so far it has been successful.  She also has a beauty and personal care service which she provides in her home or door-to-door.  When doing this she offers her other products for sale.

She plans to use the loan to buy plastic products, houshold articles and clothing for which she has already taken orders.

Her dream is to have her own house one day.

loans.use: To buy plastic products, household items and clothing

loans.name: Araksi

texts.en: Araksi T. is from the village of Kaps in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children: a 24-year-old daughter and two sons (20 and 21 years old).  Araksi has graduated with a veterinary degree.  With her training, she decided to become a private entrepreneur.  Araksi has been raising livestock for the past three years.  The extra money she earns will be saved to pay for her children’s university education.  Araksi is looking for a loan to purchase livestock, wheat seeds and barley seeds.  This investment should increase the family income by 20 %.  She also plans to help her relatives with the produce on the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, wheat seeds and barley seeds

loans.name: Dick Asmin

texts.es: Dick Asmin tiene 22 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. El dio inicio a su negocio que es una pulpería, porque es un padre responsable. Trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche de lunes a sábados y esta persistencia logra resultados, por eso recupera su inversión, pero no responde rápidamente a sus clientes porque no tiene un capital adicional. Con este crédito quiere realizar la compra de granos básicos, papel, sopas, detergentes, enlatados y otros encargos. Su sueño es aumentar los ingresos del negocio, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dick Asmin is 22 years old and has one dependent child. He started his grocery business because he is a responsible father. He works from 8:00am until 9:00pm Mondays through Saturdays and his persistence has achieved results which is why he receives returns on his investment. However, he cannot respond quickly to his customers because he does not have additional capital. With this loan he wants to purchase basic grains, paper, soups, detergents, canned goods and other orders. His dream is to increase his business income so he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, paper, soups, detergents, canned goods and other orders.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 49 years old, married, and has 1 child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 20 years, and earns additional income from a cafeteria, rice retailing and farming.

Rizalina has borrowed and paid back loans from NWTF before, and has now requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc in her store.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a widow and has 2 children. She sells shea butter, powder and ointment at a village called Ankwanda near Elmina, which she has done for 20 years. Ama uses her income to pay rent and other expenses. Ama will use the loan to purchase shea butter, powder and other things to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to purchase shea butter, powder and other things to sell

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 67 years old. He is a businessman in quarry mining and livestock keeping, and he is married to Mary. They are blessed with four adult children. He has been in the business for the past 11 years, with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings that he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for a fourth loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Jonson will use the loan to pay laborers to work in the quarry. With the anticipated profit, he will add more livestock. 

His hopes and dreams are to live a comfortable life and serve the Lord in his old age.

loans.use: to pay laborers to work in the quarry.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Mr. Hay is a 62-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Speu Province. Mr. Hay is married to Mrs. Khiev, age 61. This couple, who work together in the crop-planting business, have six children; two of the children are married and four are single. Mr. Hay is concerned that it is hard for him to walk everywhere and he dreams of having a vehicle so he can ride it to go anywhere without hiring a motor taxi, but he doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Thus, Mr. Hay would like to take out a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his and his whole family's use. With this loan, he could reduce their travel expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his and his whole family's use.

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
María Leticia es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace algunos años motivada por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y con el propósito de contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar empezó a vender mercancía desde su casa, inicialmente empezó con productos por catálogo y poco a poco ha empezado a ofrecer otros productos a sus clientes. 

En el futuro, María Leticia espera tener un gran negocio en el que además genere empleo. 

Actualmente esta emprendedora oriunda del municipio de La Unión al oriente de Antioquia, necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de mercancía como cosméticos, accesorios de plata, entre otros, así logrará incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Leticia is an enterprising woman who for many years has been motivated to seek a better quality of life for herself and for her family.  She also wants to contribute toward the household expenses, so she began selling merchandise from her home.  She started out doing catalog sales and little by little began offering products to her customers.

In the future María Leticia hopes to have a grand business and be able to create jobs.  She currently lives in La Union, to the east of Antioquia.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy a greater variety of merchandise, such as cosmetics, and silver accessories, among other things.  This way she can increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline Bibiana

texts.es:
Jaqueline es una mujer nacida en Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, tiene cuarenta años y vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 14 y 16 años. Ella se separó de su cónyuqe y vive en casa de su madre. Lo más difícil para ella ha sido ser padre y madre ya que sola ha sabido criar y educar a sus hijos.

Hace 8 años inauguraron, junto a su madre, una tienda de abarrotes cerca de un popular colegio del cantón Santo Domingo. Este negocio ha servido para sustentar sus necesidades, pero los gastos de la educación y el costo de la vida se han elevado por lo que ella quiere hacer una inversión para comprar más variedad de mercadería y así poder venderla y tener mayores ingresos. Por esta razón ella acudió a la sucursal más cercana de Fundación Alternativa, para que la puedan ayudar con el crédito que podría cambiar su vida.

Toda la familia ayuda a atender el negocio incluso sus hijos cuando tienen tiempo libre, Jacqueline junto a su madre e hijos valoran mucho la unidad familiar por lo que tratan de compartir al máximo su tiempo. Ellos sueñan con tener su casa propia, pero el mayor sueño de Jacqueline es poder ver algún día a sus hijos con un título profesional.
texts.en:
Jacqueline was born in Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas. She is 43 years old and lives with her mother and her two children, ages 14 and 16. Jacqueline is separated from her husband and lives at her mother’s house. The greatest difficulty for her is having to play the role of both father and mother because she is the only one who has been able to raise her children and provide them with an education.

Along with her mother, Jacqueline opened a grocery store eight years ago near a busy school in the canton of Santo Domingo. This business has provided for her needs, but the educational expenses and cost of living have increased, so she needs to invest in a wider variety of merchandise to sell so that she can generate more income. For this reason, she went to the nearest branch of Fundación Alternativa to request the assistance of a loan that could change her life.

Everyone helps with operating the business, including the children whenever they have free time. Jacqueline, along with her mother and children, highly value being a family so they try to spend as much time together as possible. She and her children dream of having their own home, but Jacqueline’s greatest wish is to someday see her children earn professional degrees.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is 49 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a food-vending business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy the ingredients she needs to make more food items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander de 30 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposa y tres hijos en las edades de 1 a 5 años. Allí se dedica a la venta de víveres, productos de aseo, carnes frías, lácteos, bebidas y licores. La esposa de Alexander   ofrece  servicios de manicure y pedicure, y entre los dos generan los ingresos familiares con los que su hogar cada día gana más bienestar. Su negocio está ubicado en un apartamento del barrio y responde a las necesidades básicas de las familias del sector, que requieren  comprar en unidades de medidas pequeñas, artículos de la canasta familiar para lograr la alimentación de sus familias. Su primera inversión la hizo después de vender un monto de su propiedad y con este dinero compró mercancías, que han logrado una rotación diaria y un capital de trabajo que cada día se torna insuficiente, por la creciente clientela que maneja. Su experiencia de negocio forma parte de la tradición de sus padres y por eso Alexander lo conoce perfectamente. Antes él trabajaba como mensajero y vendedor de productos refrescantes y como es una persona muy  inquieta y proyectada hacia el futuro, se capacitó en el Servicio nacional de aprendizaje “Sena”  en mecánica automotriz, para ofrecer este servicio. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará un congelador y abarrotes, víveres y bebidas en mayor volumen, con los cuales ganaría un buen descuento.  Su meta más adelante es ampliar su negocio, para atender la clientela que día a día demanda más pedidos, pero su mayor desafío sigue siendo su capital de trabajo y esta es la razón por la cual acude a este crédito, con el que planea gradualmente incrementarlo. Mientras esto ocurre maneja un margen de contribución no menor del 24,41%, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 5 días, una rotación de inventario de 10 días y su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es no menor del 21,3% , indicadores financieros con los potencializa su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Alexander, 30, lives in the south of the city with his wife and three children aged from 1 to 5 years.  He sells groceries, cleaning supplies, cold cuts, dairy products, beverages and liquor there and between the two of them they generate family income which daily increases their family’s wellbeing.

His business is located in one of the neighborhood’s apartments and it covers the basic needs of families in the sector who need to buy in small amounts items for basic consumption and to feed their families.  

He made his first investment after selling off some property and using the money to buy merchandise that has a daily turn over rate but his working capital becomes insufficient every day due to the increased clientele he’s managing.  His business experience is part of the tradition passed down from his parents so Alexander knows it perfectly.  

He used to work as a messenger and refreshment salesman but because he’s very restless and future oriented he took auto mechanics courses at “SENA” [National Training Program] to provide this service.

His Kiva loan is the first loan he’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he’ll use it to buy a freezer and groceries, foodstuffs and beverages in larger amounts to qualify for a good discount.

His goal for the future is to expand the business in order to tend to his customers who daily place more orders but his greatest challenge continues to be his working capital and this is why he’s calling upon the loan to gradually increase it.  While this occurs, he manages a contribution margin of no less than 24.41%, an accounts receivable rotation of 5 days, an inventory turn over rate of 10 days and a profit over sales margin of no less than 21.3% which are financial indicators that point to potential business growth.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and larger amounts of groceries, foodstuffs and beverages.

loans.name: Rosa Milagros

texts.es: La Señora Rosa de 29 años es Soltera y con un hijo de 12 años, la señora tiene su negocio que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche, pollo, aceite, verduras), además de golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros,  la idea de poner esta negocio es porque no existía una tienda en el lugar donde vive y vio la necesidad que tienen los clientes al requerir estos productos de primera necesidad, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de una congeladora con la finalidad de conservar mejor sus productos (pollo, verduras, gaseosas), además de incrementar su tienda con la compra de más productos. Su gran sueño de la señora Rosa es tener su casa propia, la señora está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en: Rosa is 29 years old, single, and has a 12-year-old son.  She has a business selling groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, chicken, oil, and vegetables), in addition to sweets, soft drinks, and other things.  She had the idea to start this business because there was no store in the area where she lives, and she recognized her customers’ need for basic foodstuffs.  The loan she requests is to invest in buying a freezer in order to better conserve her products (chicken, vegetables, soft drinks), and increase her store by buying more products.  Rosa’s big dream is to have her own home and she is very appreciative of the opportunity being given to her.

loans.use: buy a freezer and products (groceries, sweets, soft drinks, and others) to better stock her store.

loans.name: Lütfiye

texts.en:
Lütfiye is married and she has two children. The elder one is 22 and the younger one is 16.  She has been dealing with commerce for five years.  Before she got involved in commerce, she was a housewife and she wanted to support her family financially.  So, she joined cooking workshops, especially for Turkish food.  After she had finished the workshops, she opened a little restaurant for Turkish food and breakfast.  

Lütfiye used the credit she got from Maya to improve her restaurant’s physical appearance so that her shop is attracting more customers now.  Her future plan is to open a larger shop in the busiest street in her city and add to her menu “çiğ börek” (a kind of Turkish food).  She is a very ambitious but a modest woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Lütfiye Hanım evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  En büyüğü 22 ve en küçüğü 16 yaşında.  Lütfiye Hanım  beş yıldır ticaret ile uğraşıyor.  Ticarete başlamadan önce ev hanımıydım,artık kendim ve çocuklarım için bişeyler yapmalıydım.  Ev yemekleri kurslarına katıldım, kendimi yeterli gördüğüm zaman küçük bir ev yemekleri ve kahvaltı salonu açmaya karar verdim.  Bu aşamada eşimin desteği çok büyük oldu.Maya'dan aldığım kredi ile iş yerimde eksik gördüğüm bazı değişiklikler yaptım.  Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi ile dükkanımda yaptığım değişiklikler sayesinde müşteri potansiyelimin arttığına inanıyorum.  Gelecek için planlarım ise işlerimi daha fazla büyüterek dükkanımı daha işlek yere taşıyıp çiğ börek işine girmek istiyorum.  Ailem benim için çok önemlidir.  Çocuklarımı yurt dışında okutup daha iyi bir eğitim almalarını sağlamak istiyorum.Hırslı azimli ve çok mütevazi bir kadın.

loans.use: to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Ela Gricelda

texts.es:
La Sra. Ela tiene 41 años de edad y se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, sus clientes la prefieren ya que Ela es una mujer carismatica y que trata muy bien a sus clientes, ademas los productos que vende son de buena calidad y sus precios son justos para las personas que viven en dicha zona.
Ela utilizara el credito para la compra de abarroteria para surtir mas su negocio, desea tenerlo bien surtido para la epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se vende, se esta preparando desde ahorita para dicha fecha.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ela, 41, is a merchant. She sells goods of daily necessity in a small grocery store in her home. Her customers prefer her because Ela is a very charismatic woman and takes good care of her customers. She also sells good-quality products and her prices are fair for the people who live in her area.

She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store. She wants to have it well stocked for the Christmas season which is when she sells the most. She is already preparing for that holiday. She needs the income to cover her costs of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, shortening, oil, chips, oatmeal, milk, cereal and dairy products.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, tiene 50 años, tiene 2 hijos, sacara un préstamo de 2.000, esta en Finca hace 7 años,
Lorenzo tiene un Carpintería Metálica, recuerda que empezó con un préstamo de $50 dólares, y así poco a poco, pudo hacer crecer su negocio, en las capacitaciones que ha recibido a aprendido a administrar mejor su negocio, y ha podido comprar sus maquinarias, ahora esta muy bien pero desea poder mejorar su  Carpintería, y tener mas capital para poder hacer crecer su negocio, y mas adelante tener una sucursal, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de materiales para soldar.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a member of Solidaridad Communal Bank.  He is 50 years old and has two children.  He will take out a loan of 2,000 PEN.  He has been in FINCA for seven years.

Lorenzo has a metal shop.  He remembers that he began with a loan of 25 USD, and then little by little he was able to make his business grow.  In the training he has received he has learned to better manage his business.  He also has been able to buy his machinery.  He is doing very well now but he wants to be able to improve his metalwork and have more capital to be able to make his business grow, and later have a branch.

He will use the current loan to buy soldering materials.

loans.use: to buy soldering materials.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame has 2 children. She has received junior high education. She sells sugar-cane at Takoradi, which she has done for 3 years. Her husband is a sand-winner. She uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. 

Maame will use the loan to purchase sugar-cane to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase sugar-cane to sell.
